Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a very busy weekend in Chicago. The staff was helpful, pleasant, and went above & beyond. They were knowledgable regarding area restaurants/bars, etc. There is a light breakfast on every floor - which was convenient & definitely set the Amalfi apart. I would absolutely recommend this hotel & plan on staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beth N
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi was located in a great spot to walk to different restaurants and attractions. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is also extremely CLEAN, which is very important to me. They also have a nice breakfast setup on near the elevators on every floor-bagels, donuts, cereal, coffee, tea. Just a great stay, I would absolutely stay at there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: jenna b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Chicago, both for business and pleasure. My most recent trip to Chicago was for fun and I stayed at the Amalfi, which truly exceeded my expectations. The service was great, location superb, comfortable and clean rooms, and the extras (happy hour and light breakfast) were wonderful. The staff made us feel very welcoming and always very helpful with setting up dinner reservations and recommending bars and shopping to go to. Thank you Amalfi! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar time in Chicago staying at the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: TaraValentino
Reviews.Content: We threw a bachelorette party for my sister in Chicago over St. Patrick's Day weekend in 2012. We booked rooms at the Amalfi because of it's great price, location in the city, the FREE happy hour, and availability of the staff. Everyone was so accomodating and my sister had the best weekend. We were comfortable and happy. The free breakfast and spacious beds were an added bonus. I would highly recommend anyone staying at the Amalfi!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: family_man55108
Reviews.Content: Located only a couple blocks from the River, the Amalifi is within walking distance of anyplace you might want to go in the River North Area of Chicago. Everyone on the staff was friendly and knowledgable. My wife had discovered that she had forgotten her laptop in our room about a half-hour after we checked out. We called them and, sure enough, it was still there. We turned around and stopped back to get it -- they had it ready to go. Thank you Amalfi!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, nice extras”
Reviews.Author: RLCD
Reviews.Content: Clean and very comfy beds. Great location - near restaurants and few blocks from Michigan Avenue. Nice extras - happy hour in PM with drinks and snacks! Light breakfast items on each floor in AM (coffee, juice, yogurt, pastries, fruit, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Had high hopes, but it's just OK”
Reviews.Author: MarciaMarciaMarcia2
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews on the Amalfi, I had such high hopes. Stayed there on a Saturday and Sunday night. Had a 4th floor room facing Kinzie Street and was disappointed that my room had absolutely no view - just the ugly building across the street. I was also all the way down the hall, closest to the Public House bar/restaurant side of the building. On Saturday night, the Public House music was so loud and it went on till 2 a.m. I couldn't believe that I could hear the music that much from my room. The evening reception on Saturday night was so crowded, there was no place to sit or stand. I ended up taking my drinks and antipasta back to my room. Sunday evening wasn't as crowded, but they had the same antipasta spread. One thing I will say was great, was the alcohol selection and drinks. That was a definite plus. I also loved that Harry Carey's does the room service for food. Love Harry Carey's! As far as breakfast, I'm not a huge fan of cold breakfasts, so I thought the breakfast in the morning was just okay - a variety of pastries, bagels, cold cereals, yogurt, coffee, milk, juices, and fruit. The room amentites were fine, the furniture is kind of old - the dresser was pretty beat up as far as the drawers. The location of the hotel was outstanding - so much within walking distance. Would I stay there again? Probably not. My favorite boutique hotel in Chicago so far is the Dana Hotel & Spa. Now THAT place is a absolute treat and worth every penny and then some. The rooms are so modern, you get a lovely cooked breakfast in their restaurant, and their 26th floor bar with an open patio and fire pit is awesome. Loved that hotel so much better, I stayed there the next night which was my last night in Chicago (Monday).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: PhilandSaraF
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the International Home & Housewares show in March 2012. I found the hotel convenient to transportation to and from McCormick Place. Millennium Station of Metra was 15 min. walk. There are plenty of good pubs and restaurants to eat at within a short walk, just ask the staff who give great advice in this area. Speaking of which, the staff were great. Very nice, very helpful, from the doorman to the concierge. The breakfast, available on each floor near elevator was continental, nice selection of cold items as the name would suggest and the coffee was pretty good - even for a coffee snob like me. Street facing rooms can tend toward some noise (I was on 5th floor) so if street noise bothers you, ask for an inside room. There is free wifi available throughout and 4G signal was pretty good in that area. Wifi can, like many places, get choked with heavy use, but for free it was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a pretty decent price!”
Reviews.Author: Erin H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 03/04/12 to 03/09/12. Pros: Great location. Only 1.2 miles away from Union station; we walked to our hotel when we arrived in Chicago. Within walking distance of Millennium Park, Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, Gino's East. Two blocks away from the L line and also close to the Orange line. Great Appearance. The lobby is not as small as some people seem to be saying. It was never overcrowded. Great rooms. The room was spacious enough for me, despite what some people have said about the size. I had no trouble fitting four people in my room with me, but I suppose I can see how many more than that could get crowded. Great service. The employees were very attentive and whenever we requested something, we got it very quickly. They suggested great places for us to eat and visit, and even gave us coupons for some of the attractions we decided to see. We were greeted every time we walked into the lobby and were wished a nice day every time we left. Great price. Compared to the other hotels that I looked at, the price was quite nice. $50 cheaper than anything else I looked at, at this level of quality. Definitely worth every penny. Open Bar. I did not believe for one second that they offered a free bar every night from 5.30pm to 7pm, but they did. Not only that, their assortment of food and alcohol is not small. The bartender was amazing; he recognized who we are and what sort of drinks we would order after the first night, and he always asked us how our day had been. This is a great place to mingle with other guests of the hotel, too. Cons: The shower. The water pressure was not great, and I feel like two shower heads is kind of wasted when the water pressure is so low. Also, I feel like I may have been sharing my water with at least one other room. Almost every time I showered, the shower would randomly turn very cold. I would have to turn up the heat. A few minutes later, the shower would turn extremely hot and I would start to burn. I also noticed water pressure changes at time. Perhaps my shower was just broken in some way; the person I took with me said that his shower was fine. The breakfast. I'm not hating on the food per say, although I feel maybe there should have been a bigger or better selection. Mostly I'm hating on the toasters they provide. I burned myself trying to fish my toast out because it was broken. The noise. I requested to be put up as high as possible; they managed to put me on the 5th floor, which isn't bad when there are only 6 floors to begin with. The noise from the street wasn't bad at all, although I could hear the occasional honk. I should also warn you that this hotel is close to a fire department, so anytime there is a fire you will hear sirens and lots of them. This didn't particularly bother me either to be honest. My biggest complaint is the noise of other guests around you. I couldn't tell if it was the people staying next to me or above me, but whoever they were, they had kids, and those kids were very loud. You can hear the noise most clearly in the bathroom, but sometimes in the middle of the night I could hear very loud voices and moving about around my window. Overall impression: Would I recommend the Amalfi Hotel to someone else? Absolutely. The location, service, and overall appearance of this hotel makes it amazing. The price makes it a bargain. Would I stay at the Amalfi Hotel again? You bet. Prior to this I had only been to Chicago one other time, and I had stayed in the Silversmith Hotel. That was out of my price range this time, but I hoped to run into something that I could afford that would be just as amazing. In ways, the Amalfi surpasses the Silversmith. I intend to stay here again when I return in may to see Shpongle at the House of Blues, which is right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: toddc101 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Amalfi Hotel was one of the best ever! The staff was so extremely helpful, from arranging cars to suggesting shopping, they had me covered. This was not my first visit, and I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ama_4327
Reviews.Content: I love this place. They truly made you feel like a guest in their hotel, not just a paying customer. Free breakfast (although you have to take it to your room) and happy hour. I felt pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Ã€ good 3stars hotel, but very breakfast facilities”
Reviews.Author: family-van-den-Berg
Reviews.Content: Very weak breakfast facilities (you need to take the breakfast to your room, but there is only one chair, you need to use the desk as table,...not really comfortable). The breakfast is set in front of The elevator but we bedeed to wait 20 minutes before they came to refill it. I rare this hotel 3*.

Reviews.Title: “love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: jdteeth
Reviews.Content: this is a great place to stay while in chicago...from the breakfast every morning sitting outside of the elevator to the happy hour. great rooms and great location. what more could anyone ask for? everyone working there could not be any friendlier and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best in Chicago for Couples or Groups"”
Reviews.Author: Gerry P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi last year for our 15th wedding anniversary, and we were genuinely delighted by all aspects of our hotel stay. The location is ideal. The staff is super-friendly; the rooms are incredibly comfortable, clean, relaxing, and beautiful; and the amenities are truly of the highest quality, making a stay at the Amalfi the best value in Chicago. The complimentary cocktail/appetizers party offered daily from 530p-7pm in their Lounge is a real treat. I have reserved sleeping rooms for groups there, and I have always been quite pleased with the results. I would recommend the Amalfi to anyone needing hotel accomodations in Chicago, and we are looking forward to our next anniversary stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: mamapiper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi in Chicago for 7 nights, and found it to be a very good value overall. Perhaps the best thing it has going for it is location---a block from Michigan Avenue, and a few blocks from the Chicago River. We enjoyed the location so much, we would be tempted to choose this hotel again based on that alone. As has been said before, the rooms are small but sufficient, the breakfast is plentiful and well-presented. There was a good deal of street noise, but it is a city hotel and that is to be expected. The evening 'happy hour' offered a good antipasti and drink alternative to a heavy meal in the evening. We took advantage of it on two of our nights and found it to be quite good. The service was good, not intrusive. The lack of lobby space meant that you were in your room or on the street, but this is Chicago, and we wanted to be on the street. We arrived at 9 am and were checked-in as if all travellers arrived at that hour. We stowed our luggage after checking out and again, no questions asked. While we didn't have many needs, I had the feeling they would have worked hard to meet whatever needs we had. All in all, a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great included HH - akward breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BobKop
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi is a true business hotel and its setup resembles this function. There is no real lobby as one would expect (two seperated counters at which one sits down). Breakfast is served on every floor in front of the elevator, but no seating is provided. One can thus enjoy breakfast in bed, or take it to their meeting in one of the meeting rooms. For a regular visitor this is not always ideal, and counter intuitive. However, the quality of the breakfast is good and there is plenty of variation. The best part is probably the 5.30-7pm happy hour. Drinks are included and so are some bites. The rooms aren't the biggest, but they are very functional and overall good. The location is great. TIP 1: the hotel has some deals for local restaurants, but you have to ask for them at the front desk TIP 2: State St. Pizza Company around the corner is a great pizza place with Groupon Now and LivingSocial Instant deals ($7 for $15 and $10 for $20, it's worth checking them out the day of if you are planning to go by).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Bon33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi from Saturday to Sunday with another couple. We were both celebrating our wedding anniversaries. The hotel is in a great location! The staff is extremely nice. Both our rooms were "King Deluxe Corner Rooms". The room was a bit small in size, but it was clean and comfortable. The beds are really comfy! The hotel has an evening reception for their guests with complimentary drinks (the Amalfitini is amazing!), and finger foods (cold cuts, cheeses, breads, olives, roasted peppers, etc). It was a great way to start our evening since we were having a later dinner. Continental breakfast was offered in the morning, which was enjoyable, and was one of the better continental breakfasts we've had. One small downside to the hotel is they only have 6 floors, so the noise from the street and cars is a bit bothersome at times. Overall, a GREAT stay and we will definitely be back as long as the prices remain reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Has it all”
Reviews.Author: kathy s
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi in Chicago on Kinzie is close to everything. It is a few short blocks from the theater district. We also ate at the managers reception with a few soft drinks. (They provide meat, cheese, cold roasted veggies , brashetta bread and salsa, pickles along with many mixed drinks, beer , and champagne We also spent the day shopping on Michigan and in the loop and it was very easy to walk to hotel after. The breakfast bar was well stocked at each elevator with juices, coffees, breads, fruit, cereal yogurt and crousants

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for long weekend”
Reviews.Author: IndyGirrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi from Friday evening through Monday morning. Room was very, very clean. The king room was very spacious & the bathroom was large. Our room faced Kinzie & we did not notice much street noise other than the occasional siren or car horn. Very close to public transport - 5 minute walk to the red line station, convenient bus stops within a few minutes' walk. We did the parking package and had no issues with the valet service. WiFi worked very well. Hotel was within walking distance of shopping & many restaurants. Contintental breakfast was convenient since it was on each floor. Staff were very friendly, as they always greeted us as we went in & out & often inquired how our stay was going. Would highly recommend if you are looking for an affordable hotel (by Chicago standards) in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTess
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Chicago central that is convenient to shopping, restaurants and theaters. The staff was friendly and helpful. Especially nice is the continental breakfast located on each floor; no fighting the crowds for your croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly City Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi features all the things the business traveler needs...comfortable bed, a clean and quiet room, double-headed shower, bathrobe, etc., but it adds a host of very friendly faces and gracious touches to add to the experience. Paul, or one of his colleagues, will great you in the lobby with genuine warmth. Extraordinary cookies in the afternoon, free drinks in the evening, and a very lovely continental breakfast in the morning make a business trip feel more like a vacation. I used to select a different hotel every time I visited Chicago. Now that I have found the Amalfi, however, I'm making it my only Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Learned my Amalfi valet lesson”
Reviews.Author: Brett D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Amalfi in July 2010, 4th of July weekend. I was very apprehensive about leaving my Diesel Ford Excursion with the valet at Amalfi. It has a few modifications to the engine and can be damaged if not operated correctly. I explained the procedure to the valet drivers, and felt like it was a complete waste of time. When the vehicle was returned to me the valet driver did not let it idle down and cool the turbo off as I had instructed. When I tried to start it, it wasn't happy, but did finally start. I was so relieved to get it back I just wanted to leave. Driving away I noticed that the top speed recorded on the GPS was 105mph!!! (previous top speed was 95mph, done a few days earlier driving across South Dakota). I could just picture the flying Ferrari scene in Ferris Bueller's Day Off. I couldn't imagine where in the crowded Chicago traffic they found a place to go that fast, though it wouldn't take long to make that happen (see reference to modified engine above). A little while later we stopped for lunch and I noticed a dent in the front bumper. I contacted the hotel and was referred to their claims people. No remedy. Lesson learned. Brett

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmbgopher
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful!!! Stayed there Super Bowl weekend for a cheap getaway from the Twin Cities with the girlfriend. Took the El Train from Midway and had to walk over the bridge to get there. A short 2 minute walk. The second we got there we were greeted by an extremely friendly staff. Offering us bottled water during a very relaxed check in process. Our room was very nice, spacious and clean. The only issue I had was the tv. The cable wire was loose in the back and it had to be tightened a few times. But I was there to have fun and unwind so spent little time with the tv. The happy hour had 2 very friendly bartenders that kept the drinks coming! In 2 days probably had 10 crown and cokes with a generous amount of Crown. The dual showerheads in the shower made to a relaxing way to start the day after a great nights' sleep on the comfy beds. And the location of the hotel is amazing!!! Walked to the Hancock Building, Millenium Park and everywhere in between. A ton of bars one street up on Hubbard and the Magnificent Mile is a 5 minute walk. Excellent Hotel for a cheap price!

Reviews.Title: “Smart staff/ good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew V
Reviews.Content: I especially liked the cocktail hour. Front desk staff was very professional, smart, and helpful. Clean/ comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I'm always happy to stay there, and the friends that I've recommended it to have enjoyed it too. The check-in is very friendly, maybe because they are sitting down at desks instead of standing on aching feet all day. The front desk also provides helpful and knowledgeable concierge service. The highlight of the hotel for me is its nightly happy hour, which features an excellent antipasto bar and a variety of beers and wines. The complimentary breakfast is also quite nice, since it is set up on each floor, although I would appreciate some more lower-carb options, like a wider variety of unsweetened cereals. Personally, during four separate stays, my room has always been quiet and comfortable, but reading the other reviews, I suppose you have to be careful about the garbage truck and alley noises. Again, I've never run it that problem myself. The location is ideal, within walking distance of quite a few destination restaurants. No pool, but the exercise room is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sgabe
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were looking for something special to do for our Mom's 70th birthday. We flew her 4 sisters in from New York and got 2 rooms at the Amalfi! Everything was great from the time we got there. The staff are super friendly, Greg and Jose especially! They sent a complimentary bottle of champagne up the first night for my Mom. The continental breakfast set up by the elevator on each floor was a great way to start each morning. The cocktail hour at night was very crowded, likely due to the fact that thier usual room for this is currently under construction. The queen size beds in each room were a nice change from the standard double beds that every other hotel seems to have today. The only down side was we would have liked a place to be able to go and hang out together as there were 7 of us and it was pretty crowded trying to get us to all spend time together in one of our rooms. It was a short 5 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “would be happy to return”
Reviews.Author: dexterToronto
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in Feb 2012 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Continental breakfast was convenient, just outside our room. My only minor complaint was the coffee at the breakfast was not great, but not a big deal. We didn't notice any noise from the hallways, adjoining rooms. Great location, close to lots of restaurants, shopping and other tourist attractions. The hotel gave us a coupon for a discount off the cover at Andy's Jazz club which is just around the corner. Staff were friendly, relaxed and helpful. I would happily return to this hotel if we return to Chicago or recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Gourgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danilo1972
Reviews.Content: This is really a lovely hotel with very big room, big bath room and nice furnitures. All new. free wi fi, lovely people, nice and friendly breakfast. I warmly suggest this hotel. Great value. While there do not miss the millenium park and the navy Pier. Very close to the shopping mile and with lots of restaurants in the vicinity. The perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not outstanding.....”
Reviews.Author: fosterliz
Reviews.Content: I hate having to make the hotel decidions, and I usually do so based upon tripadvisor reviews and then make my own realistic review. At first, I was a bit disappointed....the lobby was so tiny, and no one greeted us. In fact, it was 2pm and there was only one person at the reception desk and he was on the phone for more than 5 minutes. The room was rather small, and the closet was tiny and the door was in a very bad location in the room. The TV was nice and the bed was comfy, however there was some traffic noise, afterall, this is downtown Chicago....and those taxi's LOVE to beep their horn EVERY chance they get. Convenience was that it was across the street from a good restaurant (Haray Caray's), and there was a &-Eleven and a liqour store right around the corner. There was a continental breakfast on each floor every monring which was very nice, as well as an evening reception on the 6th floor which included free cocktails and appetizers (cheese and crackers, bruschetta, marinated mushrooms, veggie tray etc), however the atmosphere in the room was a zero, as it was in an empty hotel room with a few high top tables and no seats. All in all, I would give our overall stay a 7 out of a ten.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to go to in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Big-Pimp
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 8 stay here this weekend. Everything was first class from check-in to check out. I had to make some changes to reservation at the last minute and they handled it flawlessly. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around. Rooms are clean. Nice little workout spot on the 5th floor. Continental breakfast on every floor by the elevator. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi for just one night. We booked a room that included parking and the valet parking was very convenient and fast. The rooms are clean and spacious and the continental breakfast is nice. The beds are really comfortable. The location is also great. Itâ€™s easy to walk everywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: lb5vb
Reviews.Content: I've lived in Chicago and now travel there often for work and this is hands down my go-to hotel that I also recommend to friends and family. It's extremely convenient to all of the tourist hot-spots, clean, comfortable, very affordable, and with all of that comes free breakfast, free wifi, and free happy hour that includes appetizers. Need I say more? The breakfast isn't huge. Don't expect the big vat of eggs in the lobby. It's served near the elevators on every floor and includes juices, coffee, fruit, cereals, donuts, bagels etc. The basic continental service that does the trick for me! Happy hour was also a very nice surprise. When I read about it, I expected a tiny glass of wine in a plastic cup as well as some chex mix. That couldn't have been farther from the truth. They have set up a big room with some tall tables, comfy chairs and a big screen TV to make it more of a lounge feel. (This means that there isn't a hotel lobby bar. But really? People are complaining about that? There are fantastic bars/restaurants literally RIGHT next door.) The hotel then offer an open bar as well as a big spread of Italian appetizers - breads, meats, cheeses, olives, etc etc. You could easily make a meal out of it. I've found this alternative to be a great way to cap off my work day by kicking back with a free glass of wine (or 5), chatting with other guests and relaxing while not having to be holed up in my room alone. My rooms have always been very comfortable as well as quiet. I've never run into loud AC issues like another reviewer noted. It's true - you're not right on the river so you most likely won't have a fantastic view. But for around $100 less per night and amenities galore, they can keep their view and I'll walk the one block to see the river in the morning. :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably hotel but not the best”
Reviews.Author: riverside-london
Reviews.Content: Amalfi hotel is very convenient for the centre of Chicago but doesn't have a view of the river. It is comfortably but basic - i.e. good for a night if you're on business but poor if you're in Chicago on holiday and want to be able to relax in the hotel. Positives: Great (and free) wi-fi, decent sized rooms, friendly staff. Negatives: Breakfast is poor (although it is free), noisy heating/air-con (I had to switch mine off at night), no bar or lounge to meet drinks and have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST REAL FEELING OF WINTER”
Reviews.Author: AMERICA1976
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel! I love a hotel that caters to you, if even just a good continental breakfast, but not only did they have a really good continental breakfast, but also, every night they had a coctail party with free coctails!! Wow, I have never been to a hotel who serves an open bar with coctails, beer and wine! The workers were really accomadating, and very pleasant! The hotel was in a prime neighborhood, where we were able to walk to all the major food chains, and all the theaters!! We stayed a week here at this facility, and I would definately go back again, and again! It was an excellent Value, expecially for all we got! This is well worth the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Good room and WiFi, 3rd worst breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: Mici_Eric
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, big enough and quiet room. Excellent drinks in the happy hour, but that whole concept I can live very well without. No nice lounge or restaurant (the Ravello one was beeing renovated) where you could have breakfast and hang out - and to a comment in this forum. No, I do not want to bring that breakfast to somewhere else. That breakfast, full of fat and carbs, was the third worst I have seen in a hotel of good standard. Luckily there was a 7/11 and Starbucks round the corner where I could pick up something to eat that was at least half-way nutricious and some drinkable coffee. But not beeing able to have a good breakfast in a nice environment will make me avoid this hotel when in town. Also I found it unacceptable not beeing able to even discuss late check out before 7 a.m. the same morning. The location is good, with many restaurants close by. Logging on to the WiFi was very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but better choices.”
Reviews.Author: geejaykay
Reviews.Content: My usual Chicago hotels were all sold out during a recent business trip, so I decided to give Amalfi a try. The location in River North is excellent, particularly if you're interested in nightlife. The staff was all business when I checked in - no mention of the free breakfast on every floor, I found out about that the next morning (nice surprise). Room size was good, generally clean and comfortable bed. I had a room in the back of the hotel which literally faced a wall, so the view was awful and there was little natural light. In fact, the whole hotel feels...dark and cavernous? Nothing wrong here, per se, but I think there are better options in the area, my favorite being the Dana Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Felt a little mis-leading...”
Reviews.Author: Brooke C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a last minute vacation with our 14 mos old daughter. We chose Amalfi Hotel for the great pictures and ammedities. The hotel was not as extravagant as we thought and the room was on the much smaller side that we were lead to believe it was going to be. The staff were great and the location was good. We ended up shortening our stay and going to another hotel. The breakfast service was one thing we liked by having it on each floor, however, 2 days in a row, it was moved to another floor since there was low volume on my floor. Not as good as I thought it was going to be for our first stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “one night stay”
Reviews.Author: JessLightning
Reviews.Content: perfect location. nice and modern hotel. great service. absolutely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jlonderv
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly service at this hotel. Very clean rooms. Free breakfast on each floor by the elevators - bagels, yogurt, juice coffee, fruit etc. Evening reception with free wine and nibblies. Free internet. Had a problem with my TV reception that was fixed quickly and cheerfully. Well located near subway from airport, Magnificent Mile free shuttle nearby to Navy Pier. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfwmw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Chicago on business (convention) in early January 2012. Good location, close to other major hotels and Michigan avenue. Breakfast service on each floor was convenient, although the selection was not great, and the full range of foods was not put out until 7.00 a.m. Plenty of dining and entertainment options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel...”
Reviews.Author: davidzet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location. Good: great staff, free wifi, cookies in the afternoon and decent (free) breakfast. Nice rooms! Bad: workout room has MINIMAL equipment; wifi can be weak; NOWHERE to sit next to breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Guest services are not up to speed”
Reviews.Author: xprncd_trvlr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, in a nice location, with nice decor, and the rooms are a comfortable size. However, the staff is rather disorganized. The smoke alarm in our room went off at 5am for no reason at all. We called the front desk and after 5 minutes of listening to the noise, someone showed up. The only option he offered was to move us to a different room. We suggested the alarm might need a new battery, but he said it didn't have a battery. He didn't do anything about the alarm! It had by that time stopped making noise of its own volition, but what was to guarantee that it wouldn't start again? Moving us to a different room wouldn't protect the people around us from being woken up by a smoke alarm again. We ourselves unscrewed and unplugged the alarm and the hotel employee took it. The following day, we were told by a maintenance guy that the alarms did have batteries and that these were replaced once a year and the alarm would go off if the battery went dead. If they know this, why don't they replace the batteries every 6 months, like we all do at home? The thing that really got us is that no one at the hotel even so much as apologized for what happened with the alarm. Let alone that they offered any type of compensation or good-will gesture! We had another experience with disorganization of the hotel staff relating to the temperature in the room. This was set at 68, which was way too hot for us to sleep the first night. The buttons on the thermostat in the room wouldn't let us lower the temperature. The next day, when we left for the day, we asked someone at the front desk to work on getting the temperature lowered. When we got back, we asked if something had been done about it, and the answer was no, so we asked them to do this again. When we got to the room, the found that thermostat had been set to 72! When we tried to lower it, it would now go below 68.Problem solved, despite the front desk person telling us it hadn't. An hour later, we got a call from someone telling us that they had just done something so we could now lower the temperature?? Half an hour after that, a maintenance person showed up to lower our temperature??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaraSmithToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from December 21st to 24th with my husband and daughter. I really enjoyed my stay at the Amalfi Hotel Chicago. BREAKFAST: The breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious and included a great variety of food that included: cheese,yogurt, juice,milk,coffee,tea,bagels,toast,donuts,loafs,croissants filled with lemon filling or chocolate and plain. (The staff is always they're to restock the buffett table). EVENING RECEPTION: The evening reception was also delicious, it had a great variety of food that included: cheeses,meats,pita,baggette,olives,peppers,pop,wine and they're signature cocktails. STAFF: The staff was super helpfull and very friendly. BUISNESS CENTER: The buisnees center was perfect for me to catch up with my friends and is not very busy. WERE WE ATE: 1st night: The first night we ate at Lou Malnati's pizzeria and if you inquire at the front desk they will give you a coupon for a free appetizer. We REALLY enjoyed that meal!!! 2nd night: The second night we ate at Rosebud Steakhouse and all three of us had the ''R'' burger on a pretzel bun. DELICIOUS!!! 3rd night: The third night we ate at Public House that is directly next to the Hotel and that was absolutely GREAT!!! ROOMS: The rooms were nice and clean and pillows super comfy and firm!!! LOCATION: The Amalfi Hotel Chicago was situated in a great location, close to everything. ALSO: Also, the hotel provides free newspaper and snacks in the lobby. If you ask at the front desk they will give you free water bottles wich are just the perfect size to fit in a purse or large jacket pocket. THANK YOU AMALFI HOTEL CHICAGO FOR MAKING OUR STAY IN CHICAGO SO SPECIAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rbrown9681
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. The rooms are a bit small but well designed. It is an upscale hotel in a good part of the city. Good work area for a business traveler. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “9 outta 10”
Reviews.Author: klw0575
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi for one night last week. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed ourselves there. My favorite things: -The generous free cocktail service from 5:30-7 pm. Unlimited drinks and a nice selection of appetizers (cheeses, bruschetta, olives etc). The hotel even has two signature drinks that were delicious. -The room I was in (5th floor) had a great view of the city. -Kinzie Chophouse, a restaurant a few blocks down was fantastic. -The hotel was very clean. -Bed was very comfortable. -Check out wasn't until noon, allowing us to sleep in and not feel rushed. Things I wasn't crazy about: -When we arrived, we weren't greeted right away. The two employees were engaged in a personal conversation and I was slightly annoyed about being ignored for a minute or two, just standing there, bags in hand. -The room was nice, but nothing too spectacular. One step up from the Comfort Inn I stayed at over the summer (in Pennsylvania). -Parking was $44 overnight, but I suppose that is typical for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amalfi !!”
Reviews.Author: roeboe
Reviews.Content: Was in town for four nights. A very nice hotel with courteous and friendly staff. I really liked the casualness of the breakfast buffets on each floor. Would highly recommend to anybody who wants a conveniant downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: hkevinchu
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business and our lodging was coordinated at this boutique hotel. It was clean and the staff was friendly. I had forgotten my toothbrush and on my way out the door for dinner asked where a convenience store was. They offered to have a toothbrush dropped off in my room which was there upon my return. Daily continental breakfast on each floor made it convenient for me to grab a bite to eat on my way out the door and ready to work. I would definately stay here again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: jray2436
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for five nights of our honeymoon because of the price and it's locality to the prime sights if you want a bit of a walk. It's a really handy base for getting out into the city - being chose to the Magnificent Mile and to stops for the CTA and additionally the buses however if your traveling from Union Station hire a taxi there - it's bit of a hassle and a journey trying to get there using public transport. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room itself was of an average size, with free Aveda products, wifi and a mini bar which was a little pricey but the rooms were very clean and modern looking. The free continental breakfast was a great addition with plenty of variety [fruit, yoghurts, pastries and drinks]. The room view however was a little disappointing - a view over a roof to a water tower especially when you consider the price and I would suggest this was a hotel more for couples rather then family trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tammy T
Reviews.Content: We did a two-night weekend getaway to celebrate my birthday with friends. The hotel staff was very helpful in getting our group restaurant reservations, and during our stay they were very, very friendly and helpful. The location is great, and they provide a free cocktail hour with appetizers. There was absolutely nothing they could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in our hometown”
Reviews.Author: InternationalTrvl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many high end properties in Chicago and around the world. The Amalfi is our absolute favorite hotel in Chicago. Our most recent stay was for my husband's birthday weekend. We had a wonderful, relaxing time at the hotel. The staff goes out of its way to make your stay a nice one, from the bell staff to housekeeping--everyone is terrific. The breakfast in the morning is a very nice continental buffet, with yogurt, whole fruit, cereal, and various types of pastry. It is a lovely spread. The evening service is also nice, with an open bar and hors d'oeuvres in the lounge on the top floor of the hotel. This is a nice place to have a drink before going to dinner or theater. Over the years, I've become very sensitive to sound issues in hotel rooms. I slept like a baby here with absolutely no noise problems at all. And as an FYI to people who do not frequent city hotels--the bathroom is quite large for a city hotel with plenty of room to move around (which cannot be said for bathrooms at other high end hotels in this city). The rooms are also decorated nice and bright, which is very inviting (especially during a midwestern winter). The hotel is in an excellent location--you're in easy walking distance to theater, shopping, etc. As a final FYI to dog lovers--we have stayed at this hotel both with our dogs and without our dogs. Many of us who travel with our best canine friend are concerned about what kind of room we will be given. Whether you are traveling with or without your canine pal, you will be given the same beautiful, clean room. And as a plus, there is no pet fee (and there is no size restriction, to the best of my knowledge). This is truly our favorite place to stay when we need a getaway in our hometown. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, nice rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: NWbySE
Reviews.Content: My stay here was six nights. The first three were business-related, and I stayed in a room with two queen beds. The second part of the trip was for fun, with a friend joining me in Chicago. We booked a one-bedroom suite for those three nights. This is an incredible location. On the corner of State Street, you are just a short walk to the bridge and the heart of downtown. If you like walking (and the weather obliges), you can get most places near downtown. The subway and El are also nearby. I was really happy with the location. The rooms are nicely done and a decent size. The suite was quite nice for two of us old friends to spend time hanging out. The layout is a bit odd (one tiny closet, bathroom off the living room rather than the bedroom). I was on the third floor, then the second. There are only six floors in the building, so there is not going to be much of a view regardless. The only thing that might induce me to try another hotel in Chicago is the quest for a great view. Chicago is so stunning, architecturally, and it would be nice to see that from your room. Amalfi is guilty of one of my pet peeves (the $7 bottle of water), but not the other (the minibar fridge could be used to store an item or two, rather than being electronically monitored like some hotels). But they do have a decent continental breakfast available right on your floor, which is a great perk. The Aveda soap, lotion, shampoo etc. was a nice touch. The service was great. One little thing they could do to improve: add more electrical outlets. I generally have 3-4 gadgets, and there was a dearth of convenient places to plug them in.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to shop Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Larry_K4475
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Amalfi in December to get some Christmas shopping in. It was great. We were just off Michigan Ave. The room was good size and very clean. The morning breakfast was beyond expectations, and the free happy hour was great. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: TRVLRS4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amalfi for an overnight getaway. The location was fantastic, within walking distance of Mag Mile and many restaurants. We had a king room, and it was very nice. The room was extremely clean, the bed was very comfortable and had nice linens. They have a happy hour every night with cocktails and light appetizers. It was really nice! Not just beer and wine, but mixed drinks as well. The continental breakfast was also a great perk! Great coffee, rolls, yogurt, cereal, muffins, etc. The service at the hotel was outstanding. Upon arrival, the staff secured both lunch and dinner reservations for us! Everyone we encountered was always smiling and very helpful. We were allowed to keep our car parked there until 6pm without an additional charge, which we thought was really nice. The only bad thing that happened was that our car was damaged in their parking garage. Not the fault of the hotel, and they are working with us to get it rectified. All in all, our experience was top notch! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to experience Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTraveler165
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi hotel's location, customer service, and room amenities are top-notch. Much is made about their soft bathrobes and slippers, which are so comfy, you can even buy them at the hotel store. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel and strong recommend it to anyone staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: buckigrl
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I did our annual girls' vacation in Chicago for three nights. We requested two rooms, one with a king bed and one with two queens. When we checked in, we were told there were only king rooms available. I realize this happens at hotels sometimes, but I have never had a hotel treat the matter so callously. Any other time I have had this happen, the hotel has offered an upgrade the other nights or some kind of amenity. We got nothing. Just a "Sorry, there's nothing we can do." Wow. What ever happened to making the customer happy? We went up to our rooms and I called Orbitz to see if they could help. They spoke with the front desk staff and advised me they were told something was being worked out and the front desk would call us in a few minutes. We waited half an hour and had to leave so we could get to dinner. We stopped at the front desk on our way out, and the two employees said someone had mentioned the matter to them, but they did not get all of the details. We then told them what was most frustrating was that no one seemed to care that we were inconvenienced, and most hotels would have offered something. At that time we were told they could send a bottle of wine or some other amenity to our room. Not wine drinkers, we asked to hear the other options. We settled on chocolate chip cookies, to be delivered to our room the next night. The next night, there were four tiny gingersnaps waiting in our room. Since we don't like gingersnaps, I took them back to the front desk and told them we had requested chocolate chip. I was told we would have chocolate chip cookies in our room the next night. Did we ever get chocolate chip cookies? Of course not. Did we ever get anything for our inconvenience? Of course not. We did get our reserved rooms the second and third nights, but the first night my friend had to sleep on a roll-away in the corner of the room. Classy! If we hadn't been treated so poorly, I would stay here again in an instant. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are nice. My friends enjoyed the breakfast every morning. (I don't eat breakfast, but they were very happy.) We went to the appetizer/drinks hour one evening. It was fantastic. Much nicer than I expected. And the fitness room was one of the best I've seen in a hotel. It really is a nice hotel. But unfortunately, the customer service is the worst I have experienced at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this sisterly duo loves the amalfi <3”
Reviews.Author: missyandcandy
Reviews.Content: I am completely taken back by anyone who would speak negatively about this hotel. My sister and I stayed here for a "girls weekend" and loved every second of it! The continental breakfast....AMAZING, the happy hour......AMAZING, the staff......AMAZING, and the location.....AMAZING!! Loved the decor and the extra perks, everyone was always SMILING and happy to help. From the handsome young lads helping with luggage and coolers :) to the super kind and considerate people at the desk, we LOVED IT ALL!! WAIT FOR IT................................................................... JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE, JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE,JOSE, AMAZING!!! Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGs04
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. The hotel was very modern and well-appointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us great restaurant recommendations, as well. Manager's reception with complimentary cocktails, wine, beer & snacks everyday and always snacks in the lobby. Continental breakfast each morning. We were able to check in at 11am. The hotel is within walking distance to many attractions and great food & drinks. Overall, a great hotel. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for Sightseeing, Your Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meldabs30
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again, I have no complaints. Nothing glamorous - but clean and cozy. Staff were friendly. The location is perfect for sightseeing. Price was affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Such an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: suzetdk
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet on each floor and nighly cocktail receptions are certainly great ways to welcome guests. The check-in was smooth, our room was great, the location is perfect. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, snobby staff.”
Reviews.Author: MissDianap
Reviews.Content: I personally liked the amalfi hotel, though I was skeptical about it at first. On the website it said that "friendly staff" would be there to greet us and we would be assigned to the one. When we got there, my boyfriend had to go get the attention of one of the staff himself. He had ordered some chocolate covered strawberries, and champagne that hadn't gotten there until late and everytime we approached the staff their faces looked like.. 'why am I here right now'. The nicest staff were the maids, the doormen and one guy, jose, at the front desk. We were not told much about the restaurant or happy hour, which I'm kinda disappointed about. Breakfast was good, but finished early. I may come back, but that staff was a turn off.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and enthusiatic staffs.”
Reviews.Author: frazer d
Reviews.Content: I am staying here for Thanksgiving holiday this year with my friends. When I first come in, The staffs are willing to help me with anything like transportation, Chicago attractions, etc. The room is nice and clean but I don't see any refrigerator. One thing I think you guys should know is their security policy about the debit card: They will take $50 each day you stay in the hotel and then return all the money when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: NGG186338
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Amalfi late September for 4 days and we have to say it is a great place. Front of house were fantastic, so helpful. Breakfast buffet on each floor was just right, it was good that you could take your breakfast back to your room and prepare for the day. The rooms were large and well furnished with excellent facilities, free wifi. Cleaning was A1. It was charming that we left a tip everyday for room service ( cleaning ) and we got a note saying thank you. The happy hour was a good add on which meant after a hard day of site seeing you got back and relaxed with a complimentary drink and snack also meeting other guests. It is also in a fantastic location. Our first time in Chicago and Hotel, we will be returning in March. Noel, London

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAYTON34ILLINOIS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night here for our anniversary. The valet and check in was real quick. Our room was spectacular. Very large and the bed was extremely comfortable with nice bedding. We missed out on both the Happy Hour and Continental Breakfast, but was a nice little perk to offer. My wife accidently left some very expensive jewelry in the room upon checkout. After making some very distraught phone calls and returning to the hotel over an hour later, the staff was very understandable, friendly and helpful in tracking down the jewelry. Extremely honest house keeping staff. Would recommend this hotel for a nice romantic evening.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Mile & Smile”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Sync
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi is a boutique hotel gem located in the North River district of Chicago. This means you'll have easy access to picturesque vantage points of a memorable cityscape. Head two blocks East, and you'll be greeted by Chicago's famous Magnificent Mile (North Michigan Avenue). Stroll northward and enjoy a diverse retail experience. Not so much into shopping? Head North anyways to visit the impressive John Hancock Centre, the structural impressionist architectural wonder. Not impressed by buildings? The John Hancock Centre also has the most breath-taking views of Chicago. Stroll southward from the Amalfi, and in a short walk you'll be strolling through Chicago's theatre district. A short walk SouthEast, and explore Millenium Park (you must see the BEAN) and the Art Institute of Chicago. The staff at the Amalfi were very friendly and welcoming. The free breakfast is a nice perk, especially if you're eating out a lot (because Chicago Deep Dish is must try), but you'll be disappointed if you have a meat tooth - the free breakfast is continental. The room was ample and well kept. My bathroom was huge. The Amalfi also has a palatable partner, Harry Caray's Steakhouse, so you can order it's famour fare as room service. Ultimately, the Amalfi is an impressive boutique hotel, at a reasonable price, with friendly service. If you want to enjoy the city of Chicago, especially the North River, Magnificent Mile, and South Loop, this is the place to be. It'll leave you with a Magnificent Smile.

Reviews.Title: “Zero gravity 11-11-11 celebration”
Reviews.Author: Di_dee701
Reviews.Content: Loved our room. I have never, ever stayed in a place so quiet - even the toilet was quiet. Bed and bedding heavenly. Staff very friendly and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed Chicago. We had a large group of women and a fabulous 60th birthday celebration for a dear friend. I hope to always stay here when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Happy Hour / Location / Staff”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownFarmer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a trendy hotel close to most things, this is it. Just remember it isnt a character hotel like others, but it is modern clean and friendly. The Happy Hour & half is a sweet touch - we went all nights we were there. It was fun to chat with other guests - nice feature. Lots of drink choices. Having a quick breakfast was also handy and the selection of food & drink was excellant. The staff expecially the door guys are good - nice food recommendations for stuff we didnt already check out. It is close to the loop and shopping both north and south. We had stayed further north 2 times before and found the Amalfi a nice change up. Rooms are maybe abit small compared to others but super clean. Close to car rental, all shopping and great nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and warm hospitality, The Amalfi is THE BEST in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityGirl
Reviews.Content: i just returned from 3 days at a Girlfriend Getaway, 20 of us gathering at The Amalfi for togetherness, shopping, dining and nightlife in Chicago. We were a boisterous, joyful gaggle of girls, and everyone at the hotel treated us like family. The doormen, bellmen, and concierge team made our stay perfect, helping us plan all events, dining and excursions. they were always available for photo taking, very sweet of them, and always showed sincere interest in making sure everything was perfect. The breakfasts are served on each floor, so they are intimate and PJ friendly. The evening cocktail hour features healthy, delicious hors d'oeuvres and wonderful libations. The rooms are very comfortable. The location is amazing, in the hippest neighborhood in the city, all restaurants and clubs easily walkable, and steps to MI Ave shopping and The Loop too. There is also a nice fitness center. Great value, great people, clean accommodations, we had a completely delightful time. Thank you to the entire Amalfi Hotel team, you helped make "Zero Gravity 11-11-11" the best party of the year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun girlfriends weekend”
Reviews.Author: kimandmike
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 11/4 to 11/6/2011 with 6 girlfriends. The two rooms with queen beds worked out perfect for us. Plenty of room. As others have mentioned the continental breakfast and managers cocktail hour was really nice. The breakfast saved us money and time in the morning and was appreciated. The only snafu we had was even though I had booked the 2 rooms 5 months previous with a request to have them on the same floor didn't happen. Also my room was a handicap room which is okay except for the bathroom. The shower totally flooded the floor and with 3 of us taking showers and trying to get ready in the morning it was a pain. The first morning not realizing the water would cover the whole floor some of our things got wet. I did try to change rooms but the hotel said they were full. Also for some strange reason the day before we were due to arrive I received an email from the hotel cancelling our rooms. I almost had a heart attack and called the hotel right away and they reinstated our reservation. Other than that it was a great location and we would stay here again in a regular room, not handicap.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, well located”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Richard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business last week - picked it primarily on the basis of location. It was within walking distance of all my meetings (North Loop and River North). There are also tons of good restaurants and bars within walking distance. As for the property itself it's great. Room was decent sized - mine backed onto a service lane and was reasonably quiet except for 30 mins one evening when there was a lot of noise. Bed ok though they had done something weird with how they tucked the sheets in. Best part of the stay was outside the room though - they had this awesome hosted happy hour where you could drink whatever you wanted, which is nice, and good breakfast spread by the elevators on each floor, Not sure the overall experience delighted me on any dimension but it was a really solid all round effort and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: swim_coach61
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after a fairly exhaustive search, apparently this was a popular weekend in Chicago. My stay was completely pre-paid, so I got a little panicked when I was contacted regarding my reservation and queried as to whether I wanted it... I was told that was due to a computer glitch, maybe so. Pros: Concierge (day), rest of staff, bed, convenient location, breakfast buffet, evening reception, well-appointed fitness center, real glassware in the rooms (no champagne out of plastic cups). Cons: Bathroom, airflow, curtains, spotty wifi, dying remote batteries, evening reception... Check-in was easy, after I got past the massive group checking in ahead of me -- the concierge kind of threw me in the middle of them (in a good way). The room was a little disappointing, much smaller than I had anticipated (I should know, by now to not go by hotel pics...), and the bathroom was, well... I'm afraid hotel bathrooms are just one of those things for me -- and this one wasn't. While it may seem odd, the bathroom will be enough for me to NOT stay there again -- certainly not at $200+ per night. I'm not sure the purpose behind putting a two head shower in a standard bathtub, shower curtain set up -- you can't really use it without watering down the floor. The bathroom was dark and cold; no heat lamp, no exhaust fan. And holy cow, I thought I was going to have to get up to get the TP (it really IS too far away from the toilet, bathroom designers). The amenities were fine -- I did joke that I would be smelling like a lamb chop (rosemary and mint shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion...), but they seemed to do the job. The aveda soap was nice. The bed was comfortable (very much so, actually), as were the pillows. There were real glasses in the bathroom, glass coffee mugs, and actual wine-glasses -- a nice touch. TV controls... omg are fresh batteries too much to ask for? Also, regardless of the temp on the thermostat (and we had it cranked to 75), it was cold in there. The fan runs continuously and, as with most heat pumps, the air is not warm enough to feel warm when crossing the skin -- furthermore, if the curtains are moving, then there is too much fan going on... Speaking of curtains... The curtains are pretty much useless. There are "black-out" curtains next to the windows, sheers, and then drapes. The drapes didn't close, the sheers -- you had to search for the opening, and the black-out curtains didn't come close to meeting (and staying) the edges of the windows, if they did, we couldn't find a way. So no black-out. No do not disturb signs??? yes, we were disturbed by housekeeping. In their defense, we should have had the bar lock on... But after that, and being sent away the next morning, Don't you think she could have found a Do Not Disturb sign? They have them, I saw one on a door. I liked the breakfast buffet -- there was not many folks around when I went out there, the coffee was good and hot -- the selection of pastries was great (croissant, pain au chocolat, danish, banana bread, regular bread, bagels, english muffins, do nuts, etc), although the toaster was all but useless (what is it about hotel toasters????). Tea, fruit juice, yogurt (fruit and plain), fruits (apples, bananas, oranges), and a variety of cereals. We were there early each morning but it was always stocked. The evening reception seemed pretty good -- we only went once, on a Friday night, and we weren't over-impressed (far too many people, not enough places to congregate) -- but really, it's an "open" bar with cold-cuts and chopped vegetables. And they were fresh, and plentiful, and free. So, that all seems pretty good to me. I thought the wifi as also not great -- but I didn't come to use the computer, and so I didn't sweat it too much -- annoying yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HFP52
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago recently and stayed at the Amalfi Hotel. This is a Boutique Hotel and is smaller than many others in Chicago, however, it is certainly one to consider. It is in an excellent location, very central. Easy walking distance to most of the attractions, shopping, and restaurants. Our room was a good size, (room 230) spotlessly clean, and the bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Good pillows too. The bathroom was also a good size, very clean, plenty of towels, and flannels. The double headed shower was also good. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom. Also in the bathroom there were usual nice soaps, shower cream and body lotion, shampoo and conditioner etc. A nice touch were the robes and slippers. There is also a safe in the room. One reviewer has mentioned that the lobby is tiny. Ok, it is small, however, what it lacks in size it makes up for in quality, it is nicely decorated, and the staff we found to be friendly and efficient. We didn't use the weight room so cannot comment on this. The buffet breakfast which is on each floor by the lifts was fine for us. Plenty of fruit, bagels, breads, some cheese, cakes and pastries, orange and apple juices, yoghurts and coffee. It seemed strange at first to pick this up and then take back to your room. But it was ok, and actually quite nice. You could help yourself to as much as you wanted, so you need never go hungry. Also, coffee, hot chocolate and tea in the room. There is a mini bar/fridge in the room, and also bottles of water, should you want to purchase them. These, as in all hotels, are expensive. But most people realise this anyway. Another bonus for us was the fact there is a full size ironing board and iron in the room. There is a good television with plenty of channels. A few people have mentioned the fact that the WiFi was poor. That wasn't the case for us. We found it to be excellent. Whether it was sheer luck or not I don't know, but it was fine. A great bonus was the Cocktail Hour, which actually ran from 5.30pm to 7.00pm. You could have virtually anything you wanted, from wine, beer, shorts to cocktails. There were nibbles too. Very much appreciated! Would I visit the Amalfi Hotel again! Yes! Would I recommend to friends? Yes! Were there any negatives? Not really! Certainly nothing to write about! All in all a great stay, and considering the cost of staying in other hotels in this area of Chicago, also quite reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: Good location, very helpful staff, nice reception and breakfast. Easy walking distance to many of the attractions/shopping, and dining. This is our second trip there and everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a non-handicapped room unless you need one”
Reviews.Author: fitchgirl
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was nice. Location is excellent. Staff is friendly. Beds are heavenly...or as my 5 year old puts it "very cozy". I would definitely stay here again, but next time I am going to ask for a non-handicapped room. The room itself was fine, the bathroom on the other hand was lacking counter space and the hand-held shower head just did not cut it. Not enough inconvenience though to ask to be placed in a different room. Thanks everyone at Amalfi for a nice weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ddgtcp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amalfi for Halloween weekend. This was my first time in Chicago and I would highly recommend this hotel. The entire stay was flawless, easy check-in and check-out. Exact price as I had booked, very reasonable! This hotel has everything: location, cleanliness, complimentary breakfast and evening reception, etc. I am not sure why previous reviewers said it was lacking.... Within walking distance of almost all of downtown Chicago (restaurants, nightlife, theaters, shopping, river, etc.). Take the L (blue line) from O'Hare to the Clark/Lake Station and the hotel is close walking distance. Don't waste your money on a cab! Planning my next trip already. Make the Amalfi your choice when visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Some good...some lacking”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel while in Chicago for a concert. The hotel is in a prime location. The rooms were adequate although a little dated. We stayed on the 3rd floor and street noise was a bit of an issue for us. The breakfast served on each floor was very convenient but unless you prefer mainly carbs for breakfast, it was a bit lacking. The evening cocktail hour on the 6th floor was very nice and much appreciated. The staff were very friendly and most welcoming. They offered lots of suggestions and were spot on with dinner recommendations. We would stay again but for the amount of money it costs per stay...not sure it makes sense to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fun!”
Reviews.Author: offto
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Almalfi in the past 6 months and left very happy both times. First visit was a "girlfriends trip" and we loved the great location, the amazing gym, close location to good food & drink, and the free happy hour. The second visit was a "mommy/daughter" trip and we enjoyed the close location to everything, the clean rooms, and the helpful staff with their suggestions on places to go and restaurants to try. Great cute modern hotel close to everything and oh so easy to get to from Midway Airport. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat. The only negative for a light sleeper like me; the heater was a bit loud but my earplugs helped a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: Marty S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amalfi this last weekend. Overall, we had a positive experience but I certainly agree with above reviews which complained about the noise level. There was a maddening low frequency pounding from an adjacent bar that drove me crazy and prevented me from sleeping. My wife slept OK and said she didn't hear it. I realize that this noise is not from the hotel but you should beware of this if you stay here. I'm not sure that all the rooms are affected but ours sure was.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Ever3
Reviews.Content: Three long time friends met in Chicago for a girls weekend and we stayed at the Almalfi for two nights. The hotel was clean, trendy, inviting and staff couldn't have been friendlier. You are right in the middle of downtown so you could walk to restaurants, clubs, museums and the lake quite easily. The hotel is only a few blocks from the L so if you need public transportation it was right at the doorstep. The extensive continental breakfast was available on every floor so you could pick out a couple of things and head back to your hotel room. You will not be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha77
Reviews.Content: Modern room, nice new. Hvac was broken but manager gave us a bottle of comp. Sparkling wine.

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated”
Reviews.Author: Kaerolin
Reviews.Content: I can't understand why this hotel is only a 3.5* hotel. Having spent a fair amount of time traveling to Chicago over the last year, I've stayed at 9 different hotels, and wish I'd found this one sooner. This was the lowest star rating of hotels I've stayed at and found it to be second overall only to the Trump (if you don't take price into consideration!) The quality of hotel in every respect was above par. Housekeeping was thorough and extremely attentive. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Always stocked with coffee, juices, milk, teas, a variety of cereals and breads/pastries, cheese, yogurt, and fruit. Very convenient to grab on the way out, located on every floor at the elevators. The room quality itself was excellent. Bigger than average for the typical room in Chicago with adequate and modern furniture, and a comfortable bed. The gym is clean and modern with updated equipment. Overall, I cannot understand what makes this only a 3.5 star rating. While the location of this hotel is fantastic for restaurants, shopping, bars, nightlife, my one concern is that it is a very busy area at all times of day and the Amalfi is only a 6 story hotel. I would think it is hard to find a quiet room. I requested a quiet room and thought it was great when I saw that my room backed not onto a street, but into the alley. However, it seemed I was woken for an hour or so every night to trucks emptying the dumpsters. A minor complaint to an otherwise quiet room. The wi-fi is frustratingly slow, so be advised to bring an ethernet cord, as the direct connection is MUCH faster!! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ono ono
Reviews.Content: This hotel is every bit as accommodating as any 5 star hotel. We have been staying with them for the past few years for the Chicago Marathon and will continue as long as we can. Every employee is gracious and helpful any time of the day whenever you might encounter them. The breakfasts are delicious and choices are plentiful. The morning of the race they put out fruit, juice and energy bars for all the runners at 4:30 am. The cocktail hour at the Ravello lounge is wonderful and ample. We look forward to staying with the Amalfi Hotel again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel52569
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel using tripadvisor and we're happy to say, we weren't disappointed! The Amalfi is a great hotel with first class amenities! The staff was friendly and helpful and service was very quick and efficient. We were very pleased with everything about our stay. Thank you Amalfi and thank you tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: iloveobi
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of emergencies when I arrived in Chicago. The staff helped me out tremendously with both. They were friendly and very prompt and detail oriented. I also enjoyed the breakfast served on each floor and the wonderful cocktails and appetizers every evening from 5:30 -7:00. I will definitely stay here every time I visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-they have got everything right at the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: PiscoBristol
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Expedia and decided to stay because of all the excellent reviews. We weren't disappointed. The room was large and spotless and the beds/pillows were amazingly comfortable. It was nice to have good quality Aveda products and a bath as well as a shower. As others have mentioned there were complimentary cocktails and nibbles each evening. Breakfast was served by the elevator on every floor each morning and being able to stagger a few seconds down the hall to grab breakfast and take it back to the room to eat was great. No there wasn't a massive choice of food: bagels, pastries, yoghurt, cereal and fruit but it was more than adequate for us and everything we ate was very nice. The location was ideal for us as first time visitors to Chicago. It was safe and bustling at all hours so we were very happy walking around there. Virtually all the main sights are within easy walking distance of the hotel and if you don't want to walk then the "L" is a 10 minute walk away just across the river - we got the blue-line from O'Hare to Clark/Lake and within the hour we were at the hotel. About 5 lines pass through State/Lake which is also a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We would definitely definitely stay here again, this is a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rivals the best hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: janels
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the best hotels in Chicago, even the majestic Drake and the lovely Westin. The Amalfi is around the corner from the Westin, but has it beaten on all counts. From the moment of check-in, you realize that the Amalfi is different--friendly in a collegial manner, down to every employee. They are endlessly agreeable, an incredible value, lovely, clean rooms, and a great buffet happy hour appetizer mixer on an upper floor complete the perfect stay. They keep up with all guests via email, making you feel like a valued guest and part of the family. They somehow manage to be a business and family friendly hotel in a great location for both.

Reviews.Title: “Would Come Back”
Reviews.Author: rsc344
Reviews.Content: During a recent visit to Chicago, I stayed at the Amalfi and found it to be a very pleasant experience. The location was terrific and very close to many great restaurants and obviously Michigan Ave. I'm a stickler for cleanliness and this hotel passed my test. I look forward to a return visit again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jennypn
Reviews.Content: We got the Amalfi at a great deal on HotelTonight. The room was big for a city hotel, and super clean and nice. The staff was super helpful and polite. The afternoon happy hour was really fun and the drinks and food were great. My only tiny complaint would be that the breakfast, which was very nice to have and convenient, had really no options other than yogurt and a little fruit for someone who is low carb or gluten free. So like I said, tiny complaint. Also, the parking fee is crazy, but all the downtown hotels are. We parked down the street in a garage for $28/night since we wouldn't be needing our car anyways! Super convenient to great restaurants and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: UMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi for a long weekend and would absolutely go back. Very clean, new, and friendly staff. They had several "amenities" that one does not expect in a city hotel. Each floor had breakfast - a nice selection of coffee, tea, fruit, pastries,cereal, etc. And a great cocktail hour (well 2 hours) in the evening. There was a selection of meats and cheeses in which I did not partake. One note - be sure to bring you ID as they will card you. This would be a great business hotel as wi-fi is free and there is a business center. They even have DVD's you can borrow should you want to take advantage of the in-room dvd player. Very close to a number of restaurants and bars - check out Harry Carey's and be sure to pop in Trump for a swanky cocktail with a fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....small touches made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: DarDon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago for four nights in September. The small touches made all the difference between an 'average' hotel and one that is really exceptional! Two nice touches...breakfast is served on each floor...just wander down towards the elevators for a huge selection of fruit, cereal, breads, etc each morning. The second nice touch....an open bar on the 6th floor each night, where you can meet and greet other travellers, or, just bring your fave drink back to your room! What a treat! Clean and with great, helpful staff. It's also very central to lots of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in River North”
Reviews.Author: Ravensburger
Reviews.Content: Amalfi is a great boutique hotel with a great location, close to the Chicago River, Michigan Ave, and the restaurants and nightlife of River North. The EL is near by for access to the airports, Wrigley field, and the rest of the city. Nice continental breakfast provided on every floor, and even a nicer cocktail hour with the appropriate Italian Peroni beer available. Baseball fans will appreciate Harry Carey's Restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: ngianos
