Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute on the same afternoon via HotelTonight on my phone. Definitely try the app if you haven't already. We arrived late (2am) but the hotel was very accommodating. The room was great and very clean. The location is awesome and right downtown near a ton of different bars, food spots, and easy to get to the office buildings if you're there for work. For the price it was definitely worth it. They even let my wife stick around all day long after checkout to use the business center. The only downside was a $10/hr charge for every hour you wanted for late checkout past 12noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ORTravel7
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Amalfi Hotel for 4 nights in September. The hotel was clean, modern, and in a great location. It was within walking distance of shopping, many great restaurants nearby, and close to transportation. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was great-fresh coffee, bagels, ceral, yogurt, cheese sticks, and patries. The afternoon happy hour was excellent also. Our room was on the same floor, so we took the drinks back to our room. All the staff members were nice. Would highly recommend the Amalfi!

Reviews.Title: “They had it all”
Reviews.Author: TJQ
Reviews.Content: What a delightful stay within walking distance to almost anything! The staff at the Amalfi was top notch - from the front desk to housekeeping. Everyone was professional, informative, up-beat and smiling. The hotel, itself , was spotless 24/7. Included for guests was a daily breakfast on each floor. This was not coffee and tea and boxed cereal. Breakfast included bowls of fresh fruit, assorted yogurts, bakery breads , English muffins, bagels,croissants, Danish pastries and doughnuts. There was even a toaster available. Each evening , the Amalfi hosts a Happy Hour . This, too, was quite substantial offering an antipasto-type dish as well as salsas, hummus, assorted cheeses ,breads and crackers, and crudites. The room was nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. We would most certainly return to the Amalfi. One of the best features was the assortment of guests - from visiting foreigners, to families, to business groups and wedding parties - and all of us seemed to be pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Centrally Located to Everything, Free Breakfast and Happy Hour..What More Could You Ask For?”
Reviews.Author: TaylorAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: We travel quite frequently and this hotel is awesome! We stayed here for Labor Day weekend and the hotel was at capacity but we still got a top floor room! It is centrally located and within walking distance of many places. It is across the street from the Trump Hotel (which has a rooftop bar), near Harry Carey's, Dick's Last Resort, etc. From the airport, we took the Orange Line (train) to State and Lake and literally walked about 5 min down the street to the hotel. The train only costs $2.25 per person and the taxi would have cost us about $35, so we saved a lot of money thanks to the hotel's tip! The hotel offers a full breakfast every morning on every floor and they restock it regularly so you don't have to worry about getting there early. It was very comprehensive (not sure why people complained about this in previous reviews)...cereal, milk, o.j., yogurt, bagels, bread, variety of pastries, variety of fruit, coffee, decaf, tea, etc. What more could you want? That saved us money as well. In the evenings from 5:30-7 they host happy hour (with a variety of good alcohol choices) where 2 bartenders will make you whatever drink you'd like and an assortment of food is provided - cheeses, meats, bruschetta, pasta salad, breads, etc. and you are not limited, you may go back as many times as you want. The rooms are very nicely appointed..desk and chair, chair w/ottoman, flat screen tv, bathroom is really nice-travertine tile, no dirty grout in the shower, vanity mirror, aveda products. The day bellmen deserve kudo's they are always helpful and will find an answer for you if they don't know. We were trying to find out how to get to the Chicago Trolley stop and the bellman didn't know but he went in the back to get a map and ask someone. I feel that the bellman are more welcoming and helpful than the concierge team. I would think that the concierge team would be more welcoming towards the guests, but I didn't feel comfortable approaching them for any question b/c they didn't look approachable, sort of like they were being bothered, so I always asked the bellmen questions. So if I had to rate them, they would be rated low compared to everything else at the hotel. Management, if you are reading this, please train your concierge staff. Taxi's anywhere downtown were pretty cheap, so that is another reason I'm very happy with the location of this hotel, Navy Pier only cost us $5.25 (without tip).

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJinNashville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. The welcoming was really nice, and the staff was very warm for my whole stay (4 nights). Free breakfast bar at each floor is very convenient. My room was a 2 double beds and was very nicely furnished/ designed. The hotel itself is well located downtown Chicago, and you can easily walk from there to many restaurants, bars, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: gamevets
Reviews.Content: This was a chic, simple hotel very near to Michigan Ave. We also walked to Navy Pier, but it was a bit long..however there is a free shuttle. Very friendly staff and they allowed us to check in early. The lobby is very basic, but the hotel is clean and extremely reasonable for Chicago. I will definitely recommend to friends and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel for Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: wine0wl
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi Hotel is a great place to stay in the downtown area--good central location and just a few blocks from the Riverwalk area near the Trump Tower. Rooms are tastefully decorated and exceptionally clean. The beds and especially the pillows were wonderful. A complimentary breakfast bar is provided on each floor across from the elevators and the complimentary appetizers and drinks beginning at 5:00 p.m. in the lounge on the sixth floor were a real treat. In addition, all the employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again on another Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Cocktails and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lightninglesley
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, modern atmosphere with a complimentary cocktail hour and continental breakfast. Staff were friendly. I called the "experience designer" before we arrived to ask about what to do in Chicago, and she was extremely helpful. Located in the middle of downtown. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Bugaginga
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, a good value and worth a look whether you are in Chicago for business or pleasure. Amalfi is located in the RiverNorth area which is just north of downtown. This area has many restaurants and bars/pubs. It is close to many activities if you came for fun. Walking distance to State street and magnificent mile (shopping) downtown and a little longer walk to art institute and grant park/ millennium park. Bed was very comfortable. Staff very attentive to our requests. The hotel has free continental breakfast which was decent. It also has a free happy hour every day with appetizers, which was also decent (no rot gut booze). Hotel has free wifi which is a plus since most places charge $15 or so per day. It also provides USAToday during the week. The decor is modern. Rooms are clean and a good size with all the typical amenities, desk, charging station, minibar and safe. A nice touch is they have a couple of books fi you want to read and several music cds if want music. There is a work out room with up to date equipment. Very happy with this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Take_It_for_Granted
Reviews.Content: Things started off great because we arrived early in the morning and were looking to have them watch our luggage until check-in time and they let us check in to our room right then and there. We loved the location, close to everything and mere steps from lots of good restaurants. The room and bed were comfortable, very quiet because there was no AC unit whirring away in the wall - it is centralized, but you still have local temperature control, nice. Liked the Aveda bath products. Never checked out the cocktail reception because we stopped by the first night and there was a big lineup and we were too tired to make that much effort. Having breakfast available on each floor was also a great convenience each morning. Staff were very helpful and I'm amazed at how good the room was for the price we got. Very clean and no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Boutique Hotel with extras”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi last weekend which we only discovered was Labour Day weekend when we arrived. Best thing about the hotel is the location, close to the River, transport, Magnificent Mile good restaurants etc. Hotel is a bit tired, rooms are comfortable and clean enough, we respected their policy of not changing the sheets everyday for environmental reasons, but actually think this is a bit con as saves them time and money and is far less about an environmental issue! Shower pressure is almost non existent and don't expect a hot shower at peak times. We didn't have a view from the fifth floor room, looked out at the Harry Caray restaurant and had an ice machine opposite the door. We did not find the front office staff as friendly and helpful as some other reviewers, maybe that is more about British reserve. Frequently they looked bored and were just chatting to each other. What sets this hotel apart are the extras like the breakfasts and evening reception. We only found out evening reception on the last day, so might have been nice to have been told about it when we checked in, how many people read the book of hotel services from cover to cover? Would stay here again but think the hotel should consider a bit of a renovation programme before it looks shabby rather than chic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: chickahbay
Reviews.Content: It didn't matter what time of day or night we headed out the staff always greeted us, going and coming, with a smile. Restaurants they recommended were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, with boutique, personalized services”
Reviews.Author: kkrause01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to explore chicago from. Just blocks from the blue line train that will save you from having to pay for a taxi from O'hare airport, it also is situated 2 blocks from the magnificent mile, 2 blocks from the loop, with plenty of high calibre eateries around the hotel. The best part, and the reason I booked the hotel was the free breakfasts, and the free wifi which most chain hotels do not provide. A very surprising bonus was at 6 o'clock in the evening the hotel has a complementary cocktail hour where they supply all the guest with free drinks, a very nice personal touch, where as a solo traveller, it gives you the chance to meet fellow travelers is you so wish. The room are standard, nothing special, but clean and have everything you need. Highly recommend the place for location, special touches and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, improvements could be made.”
Reviews.Author: uscballer9
Reviews.Content: This trip to Chicago was off to a bad start with me missing my morning flight. I ended up getting here at midnight and didnt check in until 1 am. This is my first time staying at Amalfi, the previous time I stayed at Affinia. The location was great, a few blocks from Magnificent Mile, Subway-Clark/Lake station and other attractions were within walking distance. Check in took a bit of time since I wanted to put incidental deposit on a different card rather than the one I used to pay for room charges, the front desk was quick to accommodate this request and sped me through the check in process. I was exhausted and starved and they gave me menus of nearby restaurants that were still open and deliver to the hotel upon my request, that was very neat. The room (209) was probably the worst room u could get, of course i wasnt expecting a spectacular view since i didnt request and paid for one. The view of the brick wall of the building next door wasnt a problem. However I felt like I was staying in a matchbox because my phone cant even get any reception. The room itself was spacious but outdated, the bed was comfortable and I loved the 2 shower heads. But the room wasnt spotlessly clean since there were strains of hair spotted in the bathroom sink and on the bed. I decided I wasnt going to be a pain over that stuff. Free wi-fi was painfully slow even though I didnt use it much. I wont complain since it's free, but if you're going to offer it to your guests as complimentary, wouldnt it be more useful if the guests can really benefit from it? It's pointless for the hotel to offer it if the guests cant really use it. I woke up late and didnt make it to complimentary breakfast which front desk later informed me that it only last until 9:30 am. I requested privacy so the maid didnt come in and clean the room but they were curteous in leaving me a note that if I wanted the room cleaned they were still available. The next morning I did make it to breakfast and it was great, not a lot of choices but they were enough to get me through the morning. My overall stay with Amalfi was good, there's no such thing as perfect but u can always try. I'd be willing to give Amalfi another try the next time I visit Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: HippieAllie
Reviews.Content: They treated us really well. Friendly service, rooms cleaned very thoroughly each day, free breakfasts and cocktail/apps hours. The location was perfect -- easy access to sightseeing, shopping, food and el lines. If you are celebrating something, let them know in advance. They'll make you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms and location but buy theater tickets yourself.”
Reviews.Author: KndlPWendl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a nice place to stay to celebrate our 20th anniversary and didn't want a chain hotel, so we took off to Chicago and stayed at the Amalfi. Not knowing downtown Chicago, it looked on the map like location might be a problem, but we couldn't have been more wrong! The Amalfi is centrally located and very near the river, Michigan Ave, the riverwalk, etc. The staff couldn't be more helpful, and the bellmen were especially good. We're not fans of valet parking, but even that was OK. The rooms are luxurious, and it's really convenient to have breakfast on each floor and not have to dress to go to the lobby. They encourage you to go in the provided robes, which are very comfortable. A couple of things to be aware of...since the hotel is downtown, the views are not so great as it is surrounded by taller buildings. But in Chicago, most people don't spend much time in their rooms anyway. One other caveat...we bought tickets to a show through their concierge about a month ahead of time which were, of course, nonrefundable. After a couple of days, I went directly to Ticketmaster and found that I could have gotten the same tickets for over $100 less. Oh well, lesson learned. Regardless, it was a wonderful experience and we will not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique and lovely boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drumlinemom2012
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, 21 year old daughter and 17 year old son stayed here one night over Labor Day weekend. Having never stayed in a non-chain hotel outside of WDW I wasn't sure what to expect. This hotel is amazing! We were in Chicago for our anniversary and I had indicated that on the reservation. We had a good rate already via TripAdvisor, but when arriving found out they upgraded us to a King suite with the huge windows and two tvs and a large bathroom with many Aveda products. We were again surprised when two wine glasses and a bottle of wine in ice came to our door compliments of the Amalfi. Such a nice touch!! The breakfast had lots to pick from and is so nice that it is on your own floor. We walked to the Grand Lux Cafe for dinner since Michigan Ave. is just a short two blocks away. This is in a great location and I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rotos
Reviews.Content: Our family (my wife, 16 yr old daughter and friend, and I) stayed at the Amalfi on Labor Day weekend. I had found The Amalfi on TripAdvisor when I began my search for a hotel to stay at. The one big thing we needed in a hotel was a suite to give the teenagers and us some separation and privacy. We booked one of their King Suite rooms and it was just what we wanted. It was much larger than it appeared on their website and had wonderful curved windows in each room. While the room was very nice the furniture was a little tired however it wasn't an issue just an observation. The check in was very quick and the bell staff are wonderful. Whenever we had any question or needed local advice someone was always available and gave us what we needed. The morning continental breakfast was a great touch and sometimes we had to go to other floors to find specific things we wanted but that is understandable. The evening reception was just OK. I say this because I think they need to do something different. It is conducted in a small room with limited seating and dimly lit. If this is something they are going to continue to do I would change the venue. This is also the only area where I felt even a little bit of attitude by the staff. It cam on Sunday night and the person working appeared to be a little put off toward the end and while I understand that can happen especially when there is free alcohol involved it still should never come across that way. All in all we would definitely return to this hotel it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all around, but why push the over-priced bottled water?”
Reviews.Author: wjames5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three-night stay here in late August amidst excellent weather. The Amalfi has got most things right: the location is nicely central between the Loop and the Magnificent Mile; it's near the river; the rates we got make it an excellent value at $127 + tx per night; the service is excellent; it's not overwhelmingly large; the rooms are spacious and well-equipped; the provision of continental breakfast and Happy Hour reception are welcome touches. In short, we would not hesitate to return to this place that doesn't skimp on the essentials, but doesn't go overboard with unimportant extras. Except in one respect, and here's my gripe: the bedside table is provisioned with four bottles of designer water priced at between $5 and $7 per bottle (see photo). Why? Is the Chicago drinking water unpalatable or dangerous? Is this something that most guests want or need? Or does the markup on this item make a good money-maker for the establishment? Strange, when hotels today try to guilt their guests into re-using towels and not changing sheets that they support such an unenvironmental practice as marketing overpriced bottles of designer water.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: scotty093
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amalfi for 3 nights in July. Front desk staff are amazing, very helpful. We loved the fact that breakfast is served on each floor; very convenient. However, the "Happy Hour" or "Manager's Reception" each evening was the highlight of our stay at the Amalfi. Great drinks, tasty appetizers and a great way to mingle with other guests. I would stay here again and have recommended it to a number of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Really Outstanding Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelsJNK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi for an anniversary weekend getaway in mid-August. We chose the Amalfi because we felt the rate we got was a good value given that it included valet parking and complimentary breakfast (all rates include the breakfast). Really glad we chose the Amalfi. We had a corner king room on the top floor. It was an odd shape for a room, but there were basically 15-20 feet of windows that provided an interesting view. The bed was comfortable and the television large, although we never could find the TV remote (only the DVD player remote). I think we could have easily had this taken care of, but we weren't too worried and didn't feel like dealing with it. We had brought some movies from home, so we just watched those. Bathroom was nice and well lit for a hotel in a city center. The theme, a modernist take on the style of the Amalfi Coast in Italy, at first seemed strange for Chicago, but in reality it's a nice way to give some more character to the urban-modern style -- made it feel unique and added charm. The thing about the Amalfi though that really made it worth staying there was the amazing service. For it's class (upper mid-range) the service was better than I would say we normally recieve. Easy check-in, easy check-out. Really polite, friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast and complimentary cocktail hour (good quality on the beer and cocktails). A nice free perk for our anniversary left in our room. Can't say how impressed I was with the service given the value of the hotel. Finally, for those who are going as tourists, the Amalfi's location is actually really good. It's on a quieter side street, but the walk to Loop and Museum area attractions is not bad at all (10 mins depending on lights), while it also has proximity to Michigan Ave and the Magnificent Mile. Also near lots of dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Good...not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: fromNYCtoMUC
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is quite good, however, it is not perfect. The location is great and the rooms are extremely quiet in light of the hotel's location. The double headed shower is a nice touch as well as the Aveda products. We opted for the corner room, which is marketed as having more of a city view. This is true, but since the hotel is only on the first few floors of the bldg, then the views are not that spectacular. All in all it is a fine hotel for the location. If I need to stay in the Mag Mile / Michigan Ave. area again then I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for people 20-40”
Reviews.Author: travelingmds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in July. I was in Chicago for a girls trip. There were 6 of us in two rooms. We loved this place. The location is convenient to shopping, restaurants, and sight seeing. They have a nighlty happy hour from 5-7pm all seven nights of the week. It was great. a great crowd, full bar, etc. . . lots of snacks. they serve two "signature" drinks -- the amalfitini was amazing! We met a lot of people during the happy hour and got great restaurant and bar recomendations from the staff and guests we met at happy hour. I'd go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Frank D
Reviews.Content: We booked Amalfi Hotel via internet in Australia and were delighted with what we found. Checking in was quick as we had pre booked . Large rooms with nice bathroom and comfortable bed. Breakfast on your own floor was easily accessable and there where lots to choose from. The happy hour was very popular with drinks and plenty of snacks and gave you the opportunity to meet other guests from various places. The location was perfect where you could walk to The Loop, Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile and plenty of restaurants. Staff answered any questions regarding tours & places to visit. We were able to catch the subway train to the O'Hare airport for $2.25 each which saved us time & money.

Reviews.Title: “European feel”
Reviews.Author: vkbrennan
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about the hotel because it was not a chain that I was familiar with, but relied on the good Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Enormous suite with full walls of windows - excellent for experiencing the freakishly strong windy summer storm that came and went quickly. Enjoyed the continental breakfast, which is served on each floor every morning and the delicious cookies and lemonade in the lobby in the afternoons. Great location. Evening cocktail reception lovely, but fairly crowded. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy, noisy, noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: tuckiefried
Reviews.Content: Ok. I really wanted to love this hotel. There are so many positive things about it but the negative aspect is too important to simply sweep under the rug. First, the positives! 1. Location! This hotel is in a perfect location to most of the popular sights and attractions in downtown Chicago. Great restaurants such as Sunda, Mastro's, etc are just around the corner. The nightlife around the hotel is close and happening, if that's what you are going for. More on that in a bit. 2. Transportation. The hotel is very close to the loop so if you need to take the CTA, you are very close. 3. Shopping. The Magnificent Mile is just a short walk from the hotel so you don't really even need a cab to drag all of your spoils back from an epic shopping trip! 4. The Hotel. The hotel itself was nice with great people working the doors and very nice people doing the check in. Jose was our guy and did a very quick, friendly and efficient check in upon our arrival. The one exception was the person we talked to about the noise in one of the rooms next door (see screaming wedding shower below). She was nice but fairly indifferent. I suspect it is because the hotel was full (I was told that by one of the doormen) and she really couldn't do anything about it. It was OK though. All I was really concerned about was whether they were checking out or if we were going to have to listen to them all night again. Negatives. 1. Noise, noise, noise. The location is VERY noisy. There are a few clubs that are very close to the hotel that were thumping until almost 5am. The PublicHouse was the insanely deafening culprit down on the corner of Lake/State, just below the Amalfi. Between the clubbing out on the street, the screaming drunks, the multiple wedding parties staying at the hotel, the SCREAMING gaggle of women in the room next to us holding a bachelorette party Saturday night then a wedding shower on Sunday morning, as well as the dozens of kids running up and down the hotel halls early in the morning while their brain dead parents were preparing for checkout, I could have gone to a Cubbies day game and tried to take a nap amongst the bleacher bums and had a better chance of getting some peace and quiet. It wasn't just a weekend thing, either. The area was just as noisy on Thursday night as it was on Saturday night. One of the problems you have with the hotel is that it has just 6 floors. Even though it looks like a high rise on all the photos you see, it isn't. There are what seemed like offices up above. So even if you get a room on the "top floor", you are still going to hear all of the chaos going on down on the street all night. That being said, I know that the club noise and the street noise is not the fault of the hotel. It's just something that is going to happen when you are staying in one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in the 3rd largest city in the US. I only mention it here in this review in case someone is choosing this hotel thinking that they are going to get a good night's sleep. It's not gonna happen, people... If the loud, drunken nightlife is what you are after, then this place is good for you. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic get away, I would find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: jillyjuan
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little confusing (I think some issues with booking multiple rooms/people on their website). After that though we all loved it. Large rooms, nice bathrooms, and very comfy beds! Breakfast on your own floor was very convenient and the hours were good for both early birds and late risers, and lots of choices! The evening cocktail hour was very popular but well organized with nice drinks and snacks. The staff showed a lot of grace under pressure. The location was perfect. Close to The Loop, Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile and tons of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Doggie Get Away”
Reviews.Author: msp_trip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago many times, but this time decided to bring our little dog along for a weekend get away in Chicago. This hotel is conveniently located downtown near the Chicago River. It is a very nice hotel, something you would choose even if you don't travel with your dog. Only the 2nd floor allows dogs, which is too bad for dog owners, as there is no real high rise view. The hotel personnel is friendly to dogs and welcomed our dog. They also offer dog sitting if you choose to dine without your pooch. You can leave your dog in the room if you leave him crated. This hotel offers complimentary happy hour (munchies and drinks) and also complimentary breakfast on every floor. We had a very nice stay at this hotel and our pooch really, really enjoyed her stay. Every Sunday there is a "canine" cruise which was very interesting to take. An hour and a half of cruising down the Chicago River and out on Lake Michigan.It is the same as the regular architectural cruise, except pooches are allowed. Very nice! We all had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: iamadaydreamer98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. This is a cute boutique hotel. Small and cozy. Close to the Chicago Theatre and many other attractions. My only complant is the breakfast... Mini bagels and mini coffe cakes, apples, yogurt. Not what I expected for breakfast. But overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “little treasure in Big City”
Reviews.Author: filisann
Reviews.Content: Amalfi is a boutique hotel with 6 floors in the River North Area. Close to everything one needs. The staff is friendly, the rooms large and beds comfy. They have a continental breakfast that is served buffet style just outside the elevators on every floor. Fresh coffee, and baked good, cereal, milk and fruit and yogurt. Very convenient, especially since they provide bathrobes, so you can run to the breakfast and take it back to your room to enjoy. However the best part is the happy hour every evening from 5:30 to 6:30 with FREE amalfitinis. The free wireless internet in the rooms is a plus. There are several very good restaurants in the area. we were here for part business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Quilting4Cats
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a two night stay at the Amalfi in early August with family members. We arrived quite early and although not able to check into a room yet, we were able to store our luggage until we we returned later. The hotel called us when the room was ready. Slight hiccup with the reservation as our confirmation showed a much lower price than what was showing on the computer, however that was corrected to show what was on our reservation confirmation (so make sure that you bring your confirmation with you!). The red line EL and the museum campus bus are only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel and are very convenient. We walked to Willis Tower and Navy Pier and both took about 20-25 minutes or so. On the walk to Navy Pier you cross over Michigan Avenue for some fantastic shopping on the magnificient mile! It is about a 10 minute walk to the Hard Rock Cafe and about a 5 minute walk to the Chicago Riverwalk. House of Blues is about a 1 minute walk from the hotel. There are a ton of restaurants, pharmacies, bars, starbucks and cafes all around. Harry Carry's is right across the street. Cabs are plentiful, though pricey, and a welcome relief for a ride back to the hotel! Taxi from O'Hare to Amalfi was $45, from Museum of Science and Industry to Amalfi was $20 and from Hancock Observatory to Amalfi was $12. We bought 3 day passes for the CTA for $14 and used that to get around town as well. The pass was well worth it and can be used on the EL and on the busses. Lou Malnati's pizza delivers to the Amalfi and eliminated an hour or more wait at their restaruant. Order early and request a set delivery time. They do not include any silverware or plates, so ask for paper products if you need it. We requested some plastic forks from the hotel and they were too busy to bring us any and would not let us come down to the front desk to pick them up ourselves! The hotel breakfast had a great variety and was convenient being right on your floor. It is set up by the elevator and served coffee, tea, juices, bagels, donuts, breads, cereal, whole fruit, yogurt and string cheese. Being able to get your breakfast and bring back to your room was so nice. The room was clean and contained the usual hotel stuff, including the $8 bottle of water! At least they marked the bottle with the price. There was a refrigerator/mini bar (that took a key) in the room but we did not open it for fear of being charged for something that we did not take, but may have moved or looked at. The hotel has computers and printers so that you can check on your flight and print out your boarding pass. Three of us had iPhones and we had no issues with the internet connection or speed. Newspapers are available in the lobby. Ask at the desk for maps and they will give you a ton of maps of the area and brochures on things to do in Chicago. The bellman/doorman was super friendly and so helpful. He really made the stay at the hotel a great one. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the service and comfort of this small boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wendy21811
Reviews.Content: Best service and amenities of any hotel at which we have stayed. The staff is professional and friendly and helpful. Love Love Loved it! Cocktail Reception from 5- 7 every night for guests and a great breakfast served on each floor. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “alwasy stay here”
Reviews.Author: katefs
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel its perfect for the city. The rooms are very comfortable very clean and the bathrooms are good sized. they have a happy hour on one of the floors, which is a nice touch. The breakfast bars are served on every floor in the morning and has more than just your typical frosted flakes in a box. Its a pretty central location and is perfect walking distance to some pretty great places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: catonmykeyboard
Reviews.Content: I'm never shy about complaining or asking for a room change - so I was pleasantly surprised that the Amalfi Hotel offered more than expected. After a long Amtrak night, we appreciated the comfortable beds as well as the luxury of not hearing the guests in the next room flush the toilet. The breakfast offerings were substantial (unless you're the sausage gravy and biscuits type). The happy hour reception allowed us the opportunity to recharge. The staff was helpful - but not fawning. Even the windows were clean! The hotel was centrally located to all the major attractions and close enough to public transit to venture beyond. This was our first trip to Chicago. We weren't surprised by the big city expense or the panhandlers - but we didn't know we'd find such friendly residents. More than once someone perceived we were confused tourists and offered directions. What is this - Pittsburgh?! In addition to the don't-miss Art Institute and Museum of Contemporary Art, try swimming at Oak Street Beach, listening to the Blues at Rosa's Lounge, or taking in the archeological finds at the Oriental Institute at the University of Chicago - followed by perusing the huge book collection at nearby Powell's Bookstore. So many things to do - so little time! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa815
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and we really enjoyed it. The room was very nice, quite spacious for a boutique hotel and nicely decorated. It is also quiet and very clean. The bed is a king sized bed, quit comfortable, the bed linens are luxurious, but the mattress is not as comfortable â€œmovementâ€� wise as a pocket sprung mattress or a memory foam. The staff was great and everything we asked for (room with a view etc.) we got it. The view of the Chicago skyscrapers was amazing. The hotel is very well situated, close to all major attraction and restaurants; we didnâ€™t have to use public transportation. The breakfast is â€œinternationalâ€� style, basic, but with a good selection and served on each floor. There is free cocktail and appetizers in the evening â€“ quit a nice concept that made us feel like in an all inclusive resort. The parking is a bit expensive and it is valet only. You have to give a 10-15 minutes notice to get your car. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: JMA_QC
Reviews.Content: Since I was traveling with my three-year-old grandson, the Amalfi made our 6-day stay easy: (1) the hotel was central so we could come back for afternoon naps; (2) breakfast was served on every floor so he could eat before taking off for the morning; (3) buses to the zoo, Navy Pier and other attractions were only a block or two away; (4) Internet access was free. But above and beyond "easy", the Amalfi staff made our stay a great experience. Every hotel employee, from front desk team to maids to the guys at the reception, was warm, friendly and welcoming. They made the hotel feel like home way from home. Definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: margoann
Reviews.Content: I love the Amalfi. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and include everything you might need. I love that the bathrooms have magnifying mirriors and a nice bench to sit on when applying your makeup or doing your hair. The free cocktail hour is fantastic. Their signature Amalifitini is the best drink ever. The breakfast on each floor is nice too. It is close to both Michigan Ave and State St shopping and there is plenty of nightlife around the corner. I will not be staying anywhere else when I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice but...”
Reviews.Author: JohnSTraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Amalfi with my wife and 11 year old daughter. It was a good choice for number of reasons. The location near the Chicago River and the Loop is great. The hotel is close to river cruises, a free shuttle to the Navy Pier, great shopping and some great restaurants (Harry Caray's is across the street). The House of Blues is 1/2 a block away. And the hotel itself has free wi-fi, very helpful in figuring out daily travel plans. However, all was not perfect. The lobby is miniscule, so there is no where to hang out on the property if you aren't in your room. The included continental breakfast was handy, but foraging from floor to floor looking for an elusive yogurt or banana bread (there is food provided outside each floors elevator) with other hotel guests seemed a little wierd. A dedicated concierge didn't exist here, leaving the doormen and reception to advise on the city. They weren't reliably accurate, though they tried. The last comment would need to be about the location. The sidewalk surrounding the hotel block is narrow and broken up and the building across the street is under construction. Overall we enjoyed our time at the Amalfi, but after several nights were certainly ready to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: beachcouple1130
Reviews.Content: I have been here 3 times, love,love,love this place. The staff is amazing, the rooms are great, clean comfortable beds. Nice to have breakfast outside your door in the morning, and a wonderful treat at 5:30-7 pm -- cocktails and appetizers in the lounge (complimentary) . Can't wait till next trip to Chi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DigitalDistortion917
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! I travel quite a bit for work, so I've stayed in my share of hotels. Great amenities that mean your time away from home will be that much easier. The entire hotel is well decorated with a contemporary flare, but never felt cold and unwelcoming. It was a perfect balance. The room was comfortable and well equipped with comfortable beds. The front desk people were nice and checked me in quickly. All of the other staff I encountered during my 5 day stay smiled and said hello as we crossed paths. The door men were helpful and quick to offer help getting a cab. The nicest part is the breakfast in the morning. As a business traveler, its a pain to have to venture away from the hotel to find breakfast before work in the mornings. It was so nice to have breakfast available not far from your door on each floor. It was a nice selection of pastries, bagels, fruit, cereals and juices. The free cocktails in the evenings are great too! Very well equipped gym - large size and good equipment. Definitely my new goto Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: ges757
Reviews.Content: The Almalfi Hotel is the best. My husband and I stayed there for a long weekend in July. Not only is the location perfect for visiting this great city, it also provided us a free breakfast as well as a coctail party at nite. The room was clean and comfortable easy to walk to and from all areas of interest. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Almalfi exceeded our expectations and when we return we will bei looking to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: topgator7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed five nights and loved the hotel. The service was excellent. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The breakfast (near the elevators on each floor) was very good and well stocked. The evening reception (from 5:30 - 7:00 each day) with wine and mixed drinks was also very nice. The location is convenient to many bars and restaurants as well as close to train and bus stops. Taxis in the area were plentiful as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite in River North area”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the hotel and it's location. Literally dozens of restaurants to choose from within a 3 block area. The hotel is always quiet, clean, and easily accessible. Having the continental breakfast on each floor is a plus along with the evening complimentary cocktail hour.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MYMYMY70
Reviews.Content: Don't book another hotel!!!!!! Amalfi is the best place to stay in Chicago in my opinion for price, service and overall service. This trip I did stay at another hotel for 1 night and it didn't even come close to what I experience at the Amalfi. Don't waste your hard earn money anywhere else. Single people you will meet alot of people at the hotel and the local bars nearby so you definitely won't be bored. April Jones

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kat_01
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi is in a great central location, you can walk to virtually everywhere. The service is fantastic. Staff is helpful, quick and very friendly. Hotel is clean and QUIET. We didn't hear our neighbours once. Great value, great amenities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - couples, families, business travellers. Special thanks to Greg the bellman, good luck with your theatre career!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Amalfi hotel while visiting friends. The location, right in the heart of the city, simply can't be beat. The reception staff were friendly and helpful upon check-in, and I liked the very efficient check-out procedure, whereby the hotel charges your credit card on the morning of your scheduled departure and slips the printed invoice under your door. The invoice invites you to stop by reception on your way out if you have incurred any additional charges, but otherwise you can simply leave when you are ready. There was one minor maintenance issue in my room upon check-in (a toilet that would not stop running) which was fixed within half of an hour of my reporting the problem. The room itself was nicely furnished and the bed & pillows were very comfortable. A couple ''extras'' which I quite liked were the plate of fresh chocolate chip cookies in my room upon arrival & the free coffee & pastries on every floor for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: mlleCurie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel twice, about six days apart. Both rooms were very clean, attractively decorated and met my needs. Common areas were clean and had chic decor. The complimentary breakfast, served on each floor, was simple but adequate to get me started each day. Free WiFi and local calls made it cheap and easy to stay in contact with fam and friends. The hotel is close to public transit, and within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park. I saw other posts that the parking is quite expensive, so I opted for a CTA day pass $5.75 for 24h). The Concierge was very helpful arranging a sightseeing activity. I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMac78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for a girls' getaway weekend. We all loved it. Clean rooms, great service, and we loved the happy hour! Saved us a lot of money by enjoying our cocktails at the hotel before our dinner reservations. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: l33anna
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi hotel was more than I expected! So modern and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful! It was close to lots of bars and a few blocks away from Magnificent Mile. We had a great time. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour were awesome with a good assortment. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CheckMan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in a package deal with our airline flights to and from Chicago between July 2 and July 8; all reviews on various sites, including TripAdvisor, were positive, which helped in my decision. We flew into O'Hare, took the Blue Line subway (about 30-40 minutes, depending on the stops, it isn't an express by any means, but is certainly cheaper than a taxi ride); we got off on the Clark St. stop and walked north across the Chicago River bridge a couple of blocks, then another couple of blocks east to the Amalfi Hotel on West Kinzie Street. It was rather hot that day, but as long as your luggage is wheeled, it is certainly bearable and worth the savings of either a taxi or a rental car (and they do have high daily charges for parking at the hotel). The lobby is small but nicely decorated. There are generally two staff on duty and I always found anyone there very helpful and friendly, more than happy to help you arrange reservations or give you ideas for excursions. We checked in without any trouble, though they do get a bit insistent on wanting you to have a key to the bar/fridge combo, since you CAN use what little room is left in there for your own food or drink. They also insist on a credit card in case you do use something out of there, even if, as we did, pay our bill upfront through Expedia. We had no problems with them upon checkout, however (no bogus claims of eating a candy bar or guzzling down one of the little alcoholic beverages). There are two elevators, both in good shape; our room, a queen bed (non-smoking throughout the hotel) had an absolutely lovely view of a roof and watertank eastward. I'm not complaining, mind you--it was just rather dominant, but if we'd wanted a fantastic view, we'd probably could have asked for a change, but no particular reason to. The bed was comfortable, though there seemed to be an awful lot of sheets fitted to it. The air conditioning is quite easy to set and very efficient, which was welcomed on the hot July 4th week we were in town. The bathroom was nice, with Aveda products available, along with a hair dryer. The closet, while not large, could have used some more hangers, but it did have a free safe for valuables and had a irorning board and iron, along with a complementary umbrella and a couple of robes with slippers (however, the ads for Amalfi seem to encourage going out into the hallway to get the free morning breakfast in your robe and slippers; as a 6'2" fella, I don't recommend it, as the exposure from the rather smallish robe would probably have gotten me arrested in most states). A LCD TV was provided with a DVD player; while the hotel does offer HBO, the other choices on their system outside of local channels, usual network offerings, was a bit on the sparce side, but you don't come to Chicago to sit in your room and watch TV, do you? It would have been nice to have a little more selection in the evenings when we were resting, however. The hotel has free internet wi-fi service, though you can also plug into their network as well. I never had any problem in getting service, though it does apparently require relogging in ever 24 hours or so, which is a bit irritating, but manageable. My Nook Color reader, which also has wi-fi capability, hooked up into the network as well with no problems. If you do not have a laptop or e-reader with wi-fi capability, there is a business center on the 4th floor that has both PCs and Apple systems with a laser printer. I was able to access my e-mail account and my business e-mail with no trouble and had no trouble printing out airline passes. As indicated, the hotel offers free breakfast every morning on each floor in front of the elevators. It is continental with cereal, juices, yogurt, muffins, danishes, croissants and the like, along with coffee and tea. Don't bother with the in-room coffee maker or the "Wolfgang Puck" brand coffee; it is absolutely terrible. Fortunately, the coffee at breakfast was quite good and the staff keeps it full during the breakfast service. The hotel also offers an early evening "reception" on their 6th floor lounge, which is essentially just a large room with a bartender. They offer a number of drinks, alcoholic and not, particularly their two house drinks, which they are happy to share the receipies for. There is also an antipasti layout and the days we went it was well attended; the food was fresh and quite good. The Amalfi is across the street from Harry Caray's Italian Steakhouse, which does provide room service upon request; it also has Keefer's Steakhouse on the first floor. Keefer's appears to have a good reputation, but the prices aren't for the faint of heart. There are, however, many restaurants within close walking distance of the hotel, any many of them are quite reasonable. We ate at Xoco (Rick Bayless' Mexican street food--very good), Maggiano's Little Italy (good), Rock Bottom Bar and Grill (good burgers and on-site brewed beers), Ben Pao's (Chinese--very good) and the Public House (brew pub with an excellent beer selection and very good food) which is a few steps away from the front door of the hotel. The Amalfi itself is basically between the Miracle Mile and the Theatre District; you can walk to many things without a problem (like the Art Institute) or you can use Chicago's excellent bus and train system. Just make sure to buy a multi-day pass when you first get in, don't lose the card and get a map; it is easy to use and we never felt endangered at any time. We took in the Chicago Chocolate Tour and the Architectural Cruise, both of which were fun (though again, for the time of year, rather hot and steamy to participate in). The hotel staff again would have been more than happy to help arrange any number of activities and they had an entire file of pamphlets to hand out. All in all the Amalfi was well worth the trip. It may not necessarily be the most luxurious or best appointed, but for the value it was good and very comfortable. We've stayed over the years in bigger-name places and not been as well taken care of. We even had one repair necessary to our toilet which was taken care of quickly and an minor emergency (lost prescription glasses) that they helped with as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Robert801
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a getaway. Hotel was perfect: clean, friendly, well-priced, perfectly located. Hotel is small enough for you to get personal service every time you walked into lobby. Room was relatively spacious and well-appointed, clean. Had some nice touches, such as a DVD player in the room and a small lending library. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CBeam
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in the River North district of Chicago. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Continental Breakfast is provided on each floor and evening reception with complimentary cocktails is also a plus. Room and appointments are very comfortable with plush towels and robes provided. Internet is free and business center includes printing. Room was very well priced for the location. This is a low rise hotel in a high rise city, so views are very limited. I booked a corner room which was supposed to have better views. Most of my view was of brick wall of neighboring bar. The extra square footage was in the hallway in the room. Not worth the premium for the room. The southeast corner, where my room was located, is adjacent to a bar that was fairly noisy at closing time. Hotel does not have a bar or restaurant, but Keefers and Harry Careys are within a half block. The Public House bar is next door. Will probably stay at hotel again. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bull's Eye”
Reviews.Author: Borisrocks
Reviews.Content: Smack in the center of town (next to the TRUMP TOWER), 1 block from the Chicago River, steps from Michigan Avenue, just sweet! Tons of eateries in the vicinity, incl. the famous (Mexican) restaurant FRONTERA and the all sorts of food restaurant PORTILLOS (a must). Millennium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago (what a collection!!), shopping - all within minutes. We had a ball in this city. Chicago's Architecture is incredible. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was served as a buffet on every floor, items to be taken to the room. Our room was elegant and comfy. No complaints - except our wake-up call for 3:00am came an hour late - bummer!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: CincyEmptynester
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3 night stay at the Amalfi Hotel Chicago. I loved this hotel. The location was fantastic. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go in Downtown Chicago. The hotel is just a couple of blocks away from Michigan avenue and there are plenty of restaurants within a few minutes walk. Try the cookies at the front desk, they are delicious. The nightly manager's reception is very nice. It was plus to be able to sit back with the other hotel guest and have a drink on the hotel. Try the Amalfi, I loved it!!!! The continental breakfast which was served on every floor was an added value. There was a selection of bagels, breads, cold cereals, juices and some fruit to choose from daily. My room was nice and there was a DVD player in the room. My only complaint was that there was a hair band on the floor between the bed and the night stand and I informed housekeeping. When I came back from sightseeing the item was still on the floor. I contacted the front desk and they sent someone to re-clean my room that evening. Other than that one incident I was very pleased with my stay and have already recommended this location to my friends and family. I travel all over the world and I have added this to the list of hotels that I would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisajmolly
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi Hotel was such good value really clean and within walking distance to most of Chicago's hot spots. The buffet breakfast was soo much more than I expected and was replenished throughout the morning

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: LBtravelernm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Room is wonderful with all the amenties plus the bed is the best. Love the breakfast on each floor and the happy hour was fun. Can beat the location. This hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stina00
Reviews.Content: We hade the best stay in Amalfi Hotel in Chicago. The staff was great and the comfort was perfect. We hade a big, clean room and we realy liked the free breakfast. And the free drinks in the afternoon was great!! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and good location”
Reviews.Author: taptaw
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel that gives great service. Check in was quick and straight forward owing to the fact that I had booked the room for the previous night, not allowing for the fact that we were overnighting on a train from Washington DC. The room was clean and everything that we had asked for. A bonus was that every night from 6.30 there was a kind of meet and greet where you had nibbles and drinks for an hour or so at no charge. This was on the floor that we were staying so this was even better. A Continental breakfast was offered and this was set out in front of the lifts on each floor, from 6.30 to 9.30 and was replenished during those hours so there was always a good choice. Staff were very helpful with any directions that we needed and quick with the the offer of an umbrella that was sometimes needed. The hotel is in a good location and in easy walking distance to most things. Would definitely recomend this hotel and if we go again would stay there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Nice Touches, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MagicCarpetCardiff
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The staff were ever so helpful and friendly. The evening cocktails and snacks (free) were great - we looked forward to returning to the hotel each evening in time for a few drinks before dinner. There was also free wifi throughout the hotel, which is very handy for keeping in touch and researching tourist attractions and dining options before you leave. The coffee machine in the room was welcome if somewhat fiddly to operate and fill, being on a slide-out drawer underneath the TV. I gave up and took the free coffee provided each morning on each floor. A buffet breakfast of pastries, cereals and toast was provided in the package too. One minor niggle was that on most days there was a note under the room door to say that breakfast was not on our floor that morning and directing us to a different one (because of low occupancy). Near the lifts there were notices to say which floors breakfast was being served on but these often contradicted the letter. One morning no letter was left and the notices were not displayed so we had to ride the elevators floor-to-floor to look for where breakfast had been laid out. Not a huge problem but just slightly irritating first thing in the morning! Everything else more than made up for this however. I would stay here again and would recommend the hotel for its good location, facilities and helpful/friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, will be back"”
Reviews.Author: blingbling34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi Hotel during the NRA convention this year. Usually we stay at the McCormick, but I am so glad they chose this location for us. Our rooms were ready early, as we had requested this since our flight left at 6 am and we were heading straight to a meeting, which was good as we were able to freshen up. The location is fantastic with lots of things to do within walking distance. The rooms were very nice, clean and super comfortable beds. The hotel offers free breakfast bar every morning and this was perfect as there was enough assortment to start the day. They also have a "Happy Hour" on the 6th Floor every night which is tended by a bar tender and there is a nice assortment of snacks to tie you over until dinner. I think the most amazing thing about this hotel is the Staff. The front desk could not have been more helpful with every need we brought to them. They went out of their way to please us and make us feel welcome. The bell station was also very nice and helpful in directing us to the right direction, even going as far as letting us know when the shuttle bus arrived across the street. I have taken shuttles before to the convention center, but have never had a bellman assist this way. My husband flew in one of the nights and did not have any issues obtaining the extra key to get into the room. We have decided that on our next trip to Chicago we will stay at the Amalfi. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Such a fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: RoswellLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi for a combination of business and pleasure. I was in Chicago for NeoCon but came in early to see the city. The Amalfi was a great hotel to stay in,. It is located in a great location to do lots of things in the city. The staff was so nice and helpful. They helped me put together a route to go running by the river and were always willing to help with information about Chicago. I had my son and his girlfriend with me for the personal part of my trip and they really enjoyed the hotel too,. While we were there the hotel hosted a happy hour everyday from 5:30 - 7:30. They provided complimentary drinks and h'orderves for happy hour. it was nice to be able to visit with other guests of the hotel during happy hour. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ianEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Hotels.com and found booking a room for the time we had to go difficult as most rooms were booked throughout the whole of Chicago . Found out once there that a huge conference , 40,000 delegates was taking place all week ,takes place every year . This meant the price we paid was double the cost for the same time 2 weeks later . This meant that the hotel represented poor value for money . However on the many other pluses where , great room , good size , fabulous bed ( very comfy) , good bathroom , helpful concierge service with very useful and accurate advice , good location near the Mag Mile and immaculate housekeeping . Downside . No catering facilities on site apart from a basic cont breakfast laid out on each floor and taken back to room and very poor , albeit free, wifi . But was given a cable to speed things up and this helped

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: AListerLife
Reviews.Content: As soon as you step into the hotel lobby, you know you are not checking into a hotel chain. There is nothing cookie cutter or mass produced. The decor is sleek and modern. The lobby chairs are over sized and the accent rugs are bold. The chandeliers are not your grandma's chandelier. The waterfall next to the registration desks give off that spa zen. And the hot jazz playing softly through the speakers accessorize the fedora wearing bellman. Oh yes, A-Listers, walk into the Amalfi Hotel and you are stepping into cool. The rooms are furnished to fit your either your business or personal needs. You have to love complimentary wi-fi throughout the hotel and iPod docking stations in your room. This is so cliche' but I have been saving the best for last. I could not wait to share my favorite two amenities. First, the Amalfi has a complimentary Manager's Reception, every evening, with appetizers and drinks.The bartenders serve high quality liquors and manage the lounge-like area. My second favorite Amalfi amenity is the complimentary breakfast. This breakfast is not like most hotels where you have to put on a pile a clothes, stand in line in a lobby dining area and wait for milk for your cereal. If you are not the cheerful morning person, that is not the way to start your day. The Amalfi sets up breakfast on every floor. Oh, what a treat!!!! Thank you's and kudos to the staff who set up and break down that many breakfast areas, everyday. **A-List tip - If you are able to make the Manager's Reception, try the two signature drinks: the Amalfitini and the Sorrento. These two cocktails are light and delicious. The bartenders have ingredients cards so you can experience these cocktails at home. http://myalistlife.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique style hotel, Great Rate, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IvanhP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night here over the Memorial Weekend. Found a great rate on Orbitz and based on TA reviews had no hesitation. Valet service met us our car and promptly gave us our claim ticket. At $44 per night, valet parking is not cheap, but is a necessary evil for this area (very few alternatives for parking). Lobby is very small but well decorated. No bar or restaurant on site. Our room was very nice, clean, well equipped and the bed was very very comfortable. The bathroom was equally clean and nice... shower had a double shower head and had great water pressure. Great added perk was the complimentary happy hour on the 6th floor. Located in the middle of the building in a conference room; it was a bit awkward and seating is in short supply but the drinks were good and the light apps were decent. Complimentary continental breakfast is served on every floor in the elevator hallway. Very convenient to grab a quick cup of coffee and bagel to go on the way out into the city. Would definitely stay here again. One piece of advice: Honor bar in the room is not cheap. $7 for a bottle of water. And there is no vending on any level. So if you find yourself needing a beverage in the middle of night bring something back to the room with you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MarkYeovil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi for a week while visiting our daughter. Agree with much of what has been said, excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff. Room was spacious, well equipped and very clean. Breakfast and evening cocktails were a bonus. Would have no hesitation in recommending the Amalfi.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels !!”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May and I have to say this is now my favourite hotel in North America and I will be recommending it to anyone visiting Chicago. The hotel is centrally located, a few blocks from N Michigan Ave, 2 blocks from the Chicago River and the Loop (downtown, theatre district etc) is just across from the river. It is in walkable distance to Navy Pier and Millennium Park but I'm sure there are buses if you don't want to walk. At night there are plenty of restaurants, bars, clubs and quick eats - just ask the hotel staff for some pointers. The rooms are spacious, clean and the bed was great for a good sleep. There is also climate control that you can control via a digital display so you can be comfortable to your personal preference. The rooms also have a mini-bar fridge and flat screen tv while the wireless internet was extremely fast. The business centre is also a nice place to be in with large screen monitors and a printer to print all your travel itineraries. They have a boarding pass computer/printer near the lobby which is a nice touch although I didn't try to use it. A nice touch from this hotel is the complimentary breakfast which is served buffet style on each level so you pick up what you want and enjoy it at your leisure back in your room. They also have a complimentary cocktail hour each night where you can get started witth a few drinks and some finger food. What makes the Amalfi special is the friendliness and hospitality of their staff from the valets, front desk staff, maids and barman. As soon as you walk in the front door you feel welcome and the hotel does have a very modern feel to it which suited me perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “How a hotel makes a person feel is priceless!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: A stylish boutique property located in downtown Chicago, the Amalfi Hotel Chicago offers a unique hotel experience. From the moment I walked in the door and was greeted with a huge smile and a wonderful personality sitting at the desk - the lady called me by name because she remembered me from November. Impressive! The hotel concierge were a hoot and so much fun. Nothing but the most polite and well mannered men working at the doors - we had so much fun with them. The kindness of the older gentleman who took the umbrella and walked us the the pub next door was just plainly awesome. House keeping kept the rooms super clean and I had not one complaint at all with the way the house was cleaned. Then I had a knock on the door and a young man stood with amenity's of dipped strawberries, fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and a bottle of water. What an awesome surprise that really made the trip start off with a bang! Thank you Amalfi Hotel Chicago for making this country girls visit to the big city such a pleasure to visit. I will be seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “Better area hotels for the same price or less expensive”
Reviews.Author: myronkjr1963
Reviews.Content: I visit/work in Chicago one week per month+ and have stayed at several hotels in the downtown Chicago River North area. On this trip I was traveling with my wife and we decided to try a different hotel. First, we have a corner room. All windows face allys and brick walls. Nothing here was completely awful, but more like average to less than average and I am a very tollerable person. Also - if you are travelinig on business, make sure you get a receipt from the front desk as the one under your door only has the parking on it - which was the straw that broke the . . . . that compelled me to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi Hotel an Oasis amongst a sea of other me-toos in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RobW3321
Reviews.Content: Amalfi Hotel is an oasis wihtin a sea of mediocre, run of the mill chain hotels and motels in Chicago. Conveniently located across from Harry Caray's it's a short walk to lots of restaurants and all the places one needs when in downtown. Purposefully designed to be different, the hotel appears as a hip entrance to a jazz club or swanky apartment rather than a typical hotel lobby. With it's Convenience Architects and Experience Designers the hotel staff strives to ensure a comfortable stay and deliver a high-level of service. The rooms are spacious with comfy KIngs, flat screens and breakfast served too. Free wireless internet and a simple desk and supportive leather desk chair provide ample opportunity to get business done. Undoubtedly the best part of the experience is the nightly Evening Reception. Hosted by Kenneth Simpson, Leisure & Libations Coordinator, the mix-master serves up warm smiles and cool drinks to provide a relaxing end to the workday and a crank-start to the evening. Ken creates a friendly atmosphere which helps you feel like you entered a party in your honor. The Italian Coastal starters which are served make you feel like your visiting Amalfi. Served up with the latest sports and smooth jazz, I wish the party didn't end a t 7pm. Ken always sends you off with a smile, handshake and a heartfelt, "Be Safe!" All the best to him and my friends at the Amalfi Hotel Chicago. Nice job, Brian Cooney! Best, Rob W.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: eahst19
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms and lobby with a decent breakfast on each floor. I missed the evening cocktails so I cannot comment. Great artwork. This is a central location for anyone who wants to see everything in Chicago. Decent Price compared to other hotels I looked at. My only complaint is that they had no vending machines. Obviously your supposed to buy what is in the mini fridge which most hotels expect. The good thing is that there is a 7/11 about 1-2 blocks away and actually a Trade Joe's 2-3 blocks away. Otherwise the front desk was very nice and valet was helpful getting cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel for What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: bikiniblonde2010
Reviews.Content: I won a free stay at this hotel from a meeting planners convention. My husband and I are mid 20's newly weds and didn't want to spend any money on gas, so we booked some cheap Greyhound tickets from Indianapolis to Chicago. If we had driven, we would have had to pay over $40 just to park our car at the hotel for one night. The hotel is in a great location - if you're into nightlife. It's next to some awesome bars and restaurants and within walking distance to the river. Our room was nice with a King size bed, but we had a view of the alley way and brick building next to us. The view didn't phase us too much, since we had the room for free anyway. I was excited to hear that the hotel provided a free happy hour time, but was disappointed with the food - just salami slices and veggies and dip. The drinks were great though, and I thought the Amalfitini was pretty good. If you like Irish food, I suggest Fado - just down Clark street-best bread pudding I've ever had. I had a little trouble sleeping at night because I could hear the sirens from outside very clearly through our windows...we were only on the second floor, so I'm sure that had something to do with it. The breakfast the next morning was convenient and just what we needed. The line to check out was long, but there was a tour group there in front of us. However, the staff were very considerate and extremely helpful for tips on local transportation and where to go in the city. I also highly recommend the Lincoln Park Zoo. You can take the bus up there (2.25 per person for the bus) and it's free! Our trip was short, but Amalfi provided just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, excellent value - absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: canadianump
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi over Easter weekend with my wife and daughter. First visit to Chicago so we wanted a great location with easy access to everything. The Amalfi was perfect in that regard as it is right in the heart of Chicago. Walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park, great restaurants and coffee shops, and public transit. But what really did it was the hotel itself. We had a beautiful, spacious, comfortable room with 2 queen size beds. Breakfast is served on every floor - awesome idea! And the social hour every evening with appetizers and cocktails was great. The staff was extremely helpful with directions, suggestions, etc. Absolutely perfect stay and all for $129 a night - hard to believe!! One small note is that we used their valet parking and ditched the car for the entire stay. They charge $44 a day which may appear steep but in researching the area, it's well in line with downtown fees. Don't let this spoil your stay in this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a weekend getaway !”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl916
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for an extended weekend getaway-Sat.-Mon. We were impressed by the friendliness and knowledge of the staff , the fun cocktail hour and generous continental breakfast. The room we stayed in was well appointed and offered very good toiletries.The location was convenient to both the El and buses that took you to many popular sites.We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TGS_5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a couple weeks researching hotels in Chicago for my daughter's 30th birthday trip for 2 adult mother/daughters. For this trip, I was looking for a boutique hotel w/ a modern feel that had queen size beds (I was amazed that most hotels still have full size beds in their double rooms). Also on my pre-requisite list was some sort of breakfast. We found at the Amalfi, both a breakfast until 10 a.m. on each floor (!) but also an evening happy hour, that went from 5 till 7 p.m. The breakfast had yogurt, fresh fruit, breads, cereal - more than adequate. Happy hour had snacks, wine, beer & mixed drinks (high end liquor). What a life saver after a full day of shopping! Robes and slippers were provided in rooms, and there were several people wearing them to the breakfast area. Now to the staff: I can't say enough about them! From the inititial reservation to checking in, to help from the concierge, to the bell staff... they were all great. The attendants at happy hour were very nice (but busy!), and sent a nice surprise to our room later for my daughter. We've previously stayed at the comparable Raffaello, but the breakfast, happy hour and size of beds made the Amalfi a better value for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Its my new favorite place”
Reviews.Author: LauraRobert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi over Easter weekend and all I can say is "wow". I bowled over by not only the service but also the amenities, location, rooms and staff. It was a first romantic get away for us and staying there made it that more special. In fact it was a nearly perfect weekend thanks in part to our accommodations. The concierge recommended some jazz and blues clubs nearby and even provided some coupons for us. Be sure to ask for t I am having company come in from out of town in a couple of months and we will be staying there again. Thank you, thank you, thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1285
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal at this hotel so I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived and it was so nice. The bedroom and bathroom were both large and clean and the bed very comfy. It is located right near the Trump hotel and just a short walk to the main attractions such as Millennium Park. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the money with welcoming staff, elegant surroundings, and great free happy hour.”
Reviews.Author: T-VanNatta
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel and we would stay here again. Great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Happy Hour, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheInternationalLine
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip + vacation w/ my wife. Our criteria -- good location, low price, free breakfast ('cause the company only covers mine), and free drinks ('cause they don't cover that!). We also spent a night at the Embassy Suites, which also met our criteria, for comparison. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Amalfi. The room was nothing special, but the location was great! Lots of walkable restaurants and nightlife nearby. Easy walking distance to all the tourist attractions, subway, etc. Tip: if you arrive by train, be sure to take the $2 water taxi from the train stations directly to the Trump Towers next door to the Amalfi. What really set this hotel apart from others was their free happy hour! They served up good drinks made from top-shelf (well, at least mid-shelf) liquor, along with a couple of signature drinks.
