They also had a good selection of cheese, bruschetta, meats, etc. to snack on each night. Yeah, the lounge got a bit crowded, but never uncomfortable. We were always able to find a seat. The free breakfast was fine, but not as good as it looks in the pictures. It was convenient to have it set up on each floor, but it was definitely "continental", with few choices for protein. Tip: grab a couple of pieces of ham and cheese from the happy hour, throw 'em in your mini fridge at night, and you can create your own breakfast sandwich in the morning when they put out the croissants and bagels. Oh, one more thing... Before we arrived, we posted to their Facebook page. Our first evening, they hand-delivered a plate of really good chocolate chip cookies and a handwritten note thanking us for our Facebook post. I don't know if everyone gets the cookies, but the personalized comment impressed us. Comparison w/ Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown: Amalfi had a much better happy hour and better service. The free internet was nice, too. Guests at the Amalfi were definitely younger and more "professional", and the decor was more upscale. The Embassy Suites had better rooms and a better breakfast, but seemed to cater more to families and leisure travelers. Locations were about equal -- they're only a couple of blocks apart. I would stay at either hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: location - right in downtown Chicago, very convenient Room - Model but a little worn, furniture chipped off. Nice big bathroom, dual shower head is good touch. Lockable mini referi, digital safe box. reliable wi-fi is free of charge. Amenities - Gym is good size and well kept. Open 24 hours/day. Breakfast is at each floor lobby, love that. food are just Ok, not fancy. Parking is expensive $44 for valey parking for a day Service is above average Price is acceptable, I paid $134 before tax

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Yitbos
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi ended up being perfect for the get away trip to Chicago. Just a few blocks from the subway, Michigan Ave, and a TON of great places to eat. The free Happy Hour was great, I was impressed with the quality, I was expecting cheap alcohol, but was surprised with the brands I saw. We didn't take advantage of the free breakfast, but it looked pretty good. The staff was all very pleasant and always greeted us anytime we came back in. I would definitely recommend the hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne13
Reviews.Content: This was a short trip, 4 women, so I will start by saying for 4 women it was a little cramped but for the two, the room is lovely. Breakfast was a bonus ,being able to go out your door and grab juice, coffees croissants, cakes and cereals. The staff were extremely nice and helpful. The Happy Hour was a very nice touch, lovely anitipasta style appetizers, lots of choices of wine and mixed drinks. This was attended by a lot of people and everyone just chatted and shared their Chicago experience. I would definetly go back to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1212_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi for 3 nights and could not have been more pleased. Hotel is conveniently located, but not right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Hotel staff were beyond friendly and helpful....from rental cars to directions - always greeting you when you come or go....beds were super comfortable - best sleep I've had in a long time. Complimentary Manager's Reception each evening was amazing - unlimited drinks and delicious appetizers (the best bruschetta ever!). Continental breakfast was ok - the norm for continentals. Try Snickers Bar and Grill (don't let the looks fool you - it was great) down the street for cheap, filling and delicious breakfast (fluffiest pancakes ever!). Public House on the corner was always packed and impossible to get in to - we managed to squeeze in on Sunday afternoon for a few drinks - didn't eat, but the food looked delicious. Pizzano's on State Street for Chicago Deep Dish - WOW! Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CMWNJ
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Amalfi a few times every year when I visit our local office on business. My most recent stay was in early March 2011 and it was so good that I am at long last writing a review. The price / value for the Amalfi is off the charts. While the hotel is hardly noticeable from the street, it is beautifully appointed inside and always offers a first rate experience. The desk-side check-in (rather than a typical counter) is a nice opening touch, feels a little more private and upscale. The rooms are decent sized (for a big city hotel room) and very updated with flat screen TV, granite counter in bath, high quality linens and pillows, and a terrifically comfortable bed. Actually, I had my best night's sleep there year-to-date during my recent visit (yes, better than home -- no pets or people to wake me up!). But the really unique touch is the breakfast buffet set out on every floor. Hot coffee/tea, yogurt, bread, sweet rolls, juices, etc. -- virtually right outside your door. All of this smart luxury comes a very reasonable price. And, the hotel is well located for shopping on State Street or Michigan Avenue, for the theatre district, fun restaurants like Shaws and Harry Carry's, and is a short cab ride away from the heart of the business district (I often walk to the Sears, I mean Willis, Tower when time allows.) I see no reason to stay anywhere else while in Chicago despite the fact that my company provides plenty of latitude to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Could be the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoalvilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: My mother and stepfather (both in their 70s) asked me to organise and chaperone them on a holiday to Chicago. Understandably, given some limited mobility issues, this took a lot of investigating to choose the best possible hotel for them. We have just returned from a full week at the Amalfi and couldn't have been more delighted with our choice. Location was perfect just off State Street, only two blocks from both Magnificent Mile and The Loop. Staff could not have been more attentive from receptionists, through to concierges and cleaning staff - all were first rate. Complimentary breakfast was the perfect start to the day, with a wide choice which was regularly refreshed. Rooms were clean and comfortable with a reasonably priced honor bar, fantastic bed linens and daily replenishing of Aveda bath products (they made a perfect present for my wife). In fairness we didn't try room service, but we did pay a couple of visits to the recommended Harry Caray's over the road which we would certainly endorse. Overall I could not speak higher of the Amalfi. Undoubtedly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. You certainly made our stay special.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I chose Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: Jen0023
Reviews.Content: We just spent our first night at the Amalfi and could not be any more pleased. The staff was kind enough to let us check in early yesterday which was a huge help as we had an early flight in. We enjoyed the free happy hour with snacks yesterday, and the continental breakfast is a definite plus. Thanks Amalfi!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, GREAT location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kleine_clan
Reviews.Content: I arrived Thursday, March 10th sans hubby for a 3 day weekend. He joined me the next day as he had to work. It was our 10th wedding anniversary. Check in took about 30 seconds, as I had already registered online, which was nice. I was surprised I wasn't asked if I needed any reservations or assistance while in Chicago. But, that was ok, since I had already pretty much mapped out the weekend. The room was nice. We had a corner room, the view was a brick wall, and a construction site. But that was ok too. I made friends with the construction workers as I checked in, they were waving at me as I unpacked. LOL The location was great!!! Many amazing places to eat very close, but I'll get to that in a minute. The bathroom was ok. I was hoping for a nice big tub to soak in, but it was a regualr tub. Bathrobes and slippers a nice plus, but there were obviously worn many times. The bed was great, as were the linens. Aveda products are always great! The breakfast in the morning was very nice. Good bagels. As was the cocktail hour. The only two things that bothered me was that I didn't get a key for the honor bar untill I asked for one from housekeeping, and my room wasn't cleaned the first day. I had walked to the French Market (take a cab!) and picked up some cheese and bread for lunch and had no place to keep it. If you are staying at the Amalfi, you MUST go to Bin 36, right around the corner!!!! Amazing food and fabulous wine and NOT pretentious at all. Harry Carey's is also a must. Ask for Sally, she was an amazing bartender. Overall, it was a nice stay. Nothing really special. The staff was really pleasant, and accomadating, but you have to ask. They don't offer much.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: CndnDream
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best boutique hotels that I have stayed at! A must stay if you are in Chicago. Very close to the theaters, restaurants, bars and Rush Street. The staff was incredible, very accomodating and made our anniversary getaway memorable!! The room and the bed were fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “girlfriends night out”
Reviews.Author: detroitchicago
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a girls night out. Loved the cocktail hour with yummy drinks and appts. Great breakfast right outside the room in the hallway, simple but good. The hotel was right across the street from Harry Carray's bar, a fun place to stop for a quick drink. A very easy walk to all shopping, the Nordstroms mall is right around the corner. The piano bar Howling at the Moon was fun and close and the front desk will give you free passes. We had dinner at Hub 51. All of these activities are within a few blocks which was nice due to the fact it was snowing and snowing. Everything was so close it was very easy to get to anything and many activities can be walked. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: lbbaby
Reviews.Content: I came across the Amalfi a couple of years ago on a birthday trip to Chicago and I was blown away! It was a day or so after Christmas, so the hotel was decorated beautifully. My birthday was on New Year's Day was great and spent with a couple that I met at the hotel during the reception hour with free drinks and Italian hors d'oeuvres. Their signature drink, the Amalfatini was delicious! The concierge and front desk staff was so extremely helpful with it being my first time in the Windy City. Last year, I had a business trip planned and I knew my hotel would be the Amalfi. I was not disappointed! The stay was awesome, immaculate rooms, the reception hour was great, nice fitness room. The continental breakfast on every floor of the hotel is a nice touch and was great for when I needed to run out for my daily seminars. I have another business trip next month, unfortunately the Amalfi is over a mile away from the venue. Not sure I'm up to walking 1.5 miles everyday...then again it's the Amalfi! Overall a wonderful stay, highly recommended for business or personal travel! I love, love, love the Amalfi!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Speechyguy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is very close to Rick Bayless's restaurant, Topolobompa. But really this hotel is close to everything: Water Tower Place, State Street, The Art Museum, etc. Upon arrival the staff quickly got us into our rooms. A complementary open cocktail bar with snacks was provided between 5:30-7:00. A nice treat! The hotel room is cozy (some might say small, but not me - how much space does one really need). The bed is exceptionally soft and the pillows are just plain luscious. I was really pleased when I found the curtain blocked almost all of the sunlight in the morning. Sleeping in was such a joy. The shower had two heads that both worked at the same time. Fantastic. The price is very reasonable for a stay in the this part of Chicago. I had a great stay and would not hesitate to stay at the Amalfi again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: suzzzeee
Reviews.Content: I joined friends who attend an annual medical seminar each November. They were already staying at the Amalfi, so I joined them. We have stayed all over the world, and at first I was not impressed with our rooms . . . they were nice, adequate, but not what I would have expected for the room price. The staff and the housekeeping personnel were wonderful, however. It was holiday time, so they were happy, festive and the hotel decorations made us smile. We had a temperature issue at night, the room was actually too hot. The engineer did help us out, but the temp had to be adjusted each night. There was construction just across the street on Kinzie, so the noise level was annoying at times. However, we were located in the middle of downtown, close to everything we needed including transportation, wonderful restaurants, and entertainment. The Amalfi has a happy hour each evening during the week and it was well planned and special. The breakfast bars on each floor were more than normal, including fresh fruit, different selections of juices and milk, cheese, pastries, and breads with a toaster provided. All in all, it was a memorable stay in a city that lifts your spirits, no matter what season you visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Right Choice For Valentine's Day!”
Reviews.Author: playaguya
Reviews.Content: We debated a bit because we had several other possibilities for our V-Day celebration in Chicago....There's a LOT of competition here. But oh yes, we were very happy with our choice. Simply put, the Amalfi is still our favorite spot. The clean and quiet rooms, the comfy beds, the friendly and helpful staff, the lobby, the location. We love it all! Their breakfast idea - slipping on a robe and slippers and going to a central area right on every floor - is great! The evening reception in the lounge is exceptional, with it's Italian-themed buffet appetizers and cocktails. We've reviewed this hotel before...We've stayed here before, and we know we'll stay here again. A perfect, romantic Chicago "weekend."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kasha68
Reviews.Content: My GF and cousin had a girls weekend and chose to stay at the Amalfi based on the reviews here at TA. We were not disappointed! The room was clean (2 queens), and while not spacious, it suited us just fine. The bathroom was perfect for 2 women getting ready to head out on the town and the concierge was accomodating in suggesting places to eat and offering us coupons to other venues. We had a refrigerator/mini bar in our room and while we didn't partake, the prices were in line with what you could expect. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were quiet (no banging or loud voices could be heard through our rooms). The managers reception was fantastic and a great way to kick off a night. The appetizers were good, nothing outstanding, but certainly a nice way to sit and enjoy some finger food and spirits. The only issue we had was when we called down for a wake up call as we had an early flight and we never got one! Luckily we had set our clocks in our rooms. This wouldn't deter us from recommending this great hotel! I am planning to come back and take my boyfriend here, as the location is great. It's just off Michigan Ave, so while you are in the heart of downtown, you don't get the loud noises of downtown. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler789
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one I would return to again. The rooms are well appointed and clean, the staff is attentive and polite, having breakfast available on each floor and wi-fi included is a plus. The restaurant you can access through the lobby-Keefer's-is excellent and convenient. And one night after dinner we were pleased to be able to walk to a fun live music venue. It was called Andy's I think.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: If you need a top notch downtown hotel in Chicago, this is the place to stay. Reservations: easy over the internet using TripAdvisor--got a GREAT rate!!!!!!!! Check-in: fast efficient and courteous Lobby: very chic Room: spacious, with top of the line linens, towels, bath products, flat screen TV. Fitness Center: remarkably good for a small boutique hotel Check-out: fast efficient accurate and courteous Additional Notes: FREE HIGH SPEED WIRELESS INTERNET WITH AN EXCELLENT CONNECTION EVERYWHERE IN THE HOTEL AND A SUPERB FREE CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST ON EVERY FLOOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: zachlukecal
Reviews.Content: Stayed downtown to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. They gave us a suite at no extra cost when they found out we were there for a special occasion. Super clean room and great location. We walked to dinner and there were tons of places to choose from all in walking distance. We did not take advantage of the coctail hour as we went out but the continental breakfast in the morning was a nice touch. Will stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AmantedelCaribe
Reviews.Content: My sister treated me to a night on the town and this was where we stayed. I loved it! The room: small but lovely; amazing view Customer service: AMAZING! From the moment we pulled up in my ratty Civic, every staff member treated us with the utmost courtesy. They anticipated every need we had. Breakfast/happy hour: A great perk! The breakfast was better than the typical continental breakfast but the happy hour was great!! Free drinks (and they were pretty good!), free appetizers (also good).... I would love to stay here again. It's chic but not pretentious, comfortable but modern- perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown location, pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: MaineScott
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2011 while in Chicago on business. The hotel was very conveniently located for my trip, and the room rates seem very good for a nice property in downtown Chicago. The downtown location is convenient to the Magnificent Mile and other touristy sites. There are tons of restaurants nearby, and the Blue Line (to/from O'Hare) train stops just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Overall the location couldn't have been much more convenient for me. The hotel is very trendy and contemporary. The public areas and the rooms appeared clean and well maintained. The staff that I interacted with were all friendly. The hotel was suitably quiet despite the location in the heart of downtown. I did make use of the business center, which was great for printing boarding passes. I also made use of the fitness center, which isn't huge, but has a nice enough selection of cardio equipment and weights/machines. There is a free nightly reception, and in the morning breakfast is laid out on each floor, rather than making you go to a central location. (The breakfast offerings were just so-so though.) There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel, which was also great. The room itself was clean and reasonably comfortable. The rooms aren't huge by normal standards, but for downtown Chicago they're pretty nice. The TV was a little disappointing. They're on the small side, the TV reception isn't very good, and the remotes are pretty terrible. The clock/radio appears to have many features, but it was actually kind of difficult to use. The bathroom was pretty spacious, with lots of counter space and a dual-head shower. Overall I would return to this property if I need to be in downtown Chicago again. For the price it's a pretty nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have never had a bad stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Tarymc
Reviews.Content: The staff is great. Their always friendly and helpful. Everytime I go I see some of the same guest each time. To me this means people keep coming back. It may not have all the amenities that the larger hotels have, but it also doesn't have the noise and the strangers behind the desk or at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: TAnewcomer
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Price Line. I didn't expect much because we just needed a place to stay while visiting friends for Thanksgiving. I was pleasantly surprised. I think it is a boutique hotel with a small lobby. The room was adequately sized and nicely furnished. It was comfortable. They also had a room for happy hour. That was nice. The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly because we did not know Chicago at all. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pecoskid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi for 4 nights while on chicago for a conference in November, 2010. The staff was helpful, the room was attractive and clean, and the complimentary breakfast in the elevator lobby on each floor was very nice. The complimentary nightly happy hour was an unexpected and welcome treat. The group of colleagues I was with met there every night for several drinks, and to make dinner plans. This was a great bonus to stay at the Amalfi. Finally, the River North neighborhood had numerous restaurants and bars in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: obwon1
Reviews.Content: our hotel stay was amazing! This hotel is beautiful and very, very clean. I can honestly say that I have never slept so well in a hotel-the beds are SO comfortable and the pillows were fantastic. The breakfast on every floor was so convenient and a great way to start the day. I figured we would have spent so much if we had eaten out every morning-so this was well worth the price of the stay. You can not go wrong with this hotel! It is located close to shopping and great restaurants and in a very safe area. I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: jillgill1807
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for 3 nights with my friend. We were very impressed, and pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel. The room was a good size, and the beds clean and very comfortable. They also provide free Wi-Fi access and provide an alarm clock which has an integrated I-pod dock. Breakfast was great, and the cocktail lounge provided pretty much any drink you can think off. The location of the hotel is excellent, views from our room included the newly built Trump International Hotel, and Harry Carays restaurant was just across the street. All in all, a fantastic hotel, with great facilities and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, customer service even better”
Reviews.Author: Robin041
Reviews.Content: We were not originally set to stay at the Amalfi, however the hotel we had planned to stay at inadvertently cancelled our reservation without notice (on New Years Eve at that) and the Amalfi came to our rescue. The front desk manager went out of her way to help us get checked in and settled, knowing what we'd been through. The room was nice, the breakfast on each floor was delicious, we enjoyed our stay and were in walking distance of Michigan Ave. Thanks to the Amalfi for saving our trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great loc in River North area”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and really like the location. Very convenient for shopping and dining options. Value is rated high, since I got the king room booked at $99/night. My wife enjoys the continental breakfast since it's set up on EACH FLOOR of the hotel. No need to go down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Service 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY recommend the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago. It is a stylish boutique hotel that has a great location with easy walking distance to downtown or the shopping district. The service was always friends and top class. Super clean - the bathroom was nice with lots of room - the beds were SOO Super comfortable. I will be using this hotel again in 2011 and look forward to staying again. One of the neatest things I have seen is that breakfast was served on each floor. I could simply walk out get my food and return to my room to eat with out getting dressed up for breakfast -*Thumbs up*

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: iluv2travl
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times now. good location, even in the winter. Very comfortable beds,quiet clean rooms,large bathroom,flat screen tv,bathrobes and slippers good for people like me who travel as lightly as possible. The things that make this hotel special is the evening reception with snacks and drinks, and the morning continental expanded breakfast served on each floor seperately. Free wireless is always a wonderful thing, as is their business center that is open for your use 24 hours. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to chicago, it is close to Merchandise Mart if you are headed in that direction. There is also a very reasonable parking garage about 2 blocks away Sterling parking garage on the corner of LaSalle & Kinzie. My last stay was a special offered on the hotels web site for $99 for 4 of us, so felt that we got a very good bargain. There is nothing about this hotel that I disliked.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: passages_10
Reviews.Content: We had a really wonderful stay at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago. We chose the hotel for our annual shopping weekend, and we were not disappointed. The location was close to many stores, in a very progressive neighborhood with many restaurants. The hotel provides breakfast each morning and a Happy Hour each evening. Both are not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the happy hour”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago. It is a stylish boutique hotel that has a great location with easy walking distance to downtown or the shopping district. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. The service staff was nice and friendly and they offer breakfast on each floor in the morning. One thing I LOVED was they have a free happy hour complete with cocktails and appitizers...nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in near north Chicago”
Reviews.Author: grdhou
Reviews.Content: We learned about this on Trpadvisor. It is a superb choice for loop area in Chicago. It's 1 block north of the river on State. The neighborhood is loaded with restaurants and pubs. The hotel offers complimentary drinks and snacks daily at 5:30 and breakfasts, so value is excellent. I'd go back without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Price”
Reviews.Author: gizellemarie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night as a little mid-week getaway, and we couldn't have been happier with our experience. From the lobby to the cocktail lounge to our room, everything was clean and comfortable. The free appetizers/drinks at 5:30 every day were a great touch and a nice way to get our evening started. The room was bigger than we thought it would be and the amenities were lovely. The decor was modern and chic, and even the bathroom exceeded our expectations. Plus we got a great deal through the hotel's website. I'd highly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to visit Chicago and even for locals looking for a little break from the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: piotrwasil
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice hotel, close to Michigan Ave. The view from the room is average, but this is always the case in Chicago when you stay in lower levels :-). Room is OK for a 4 star hotel, very clean and comfortable with free internet, but the price of almost 200$ with tax is a bit too much, even for Chicago. There is a free breakfast provided, but this is American style breakfast - a table on every floor with coffee, tea, soft drinks and some muffins. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “All-in-all, I very much liked my stay at the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: eliteceo
Reviews.Content: I travel often but usually donâ€™t need to stay in hotels (most travel is to my 2nd home on the west coast). The week of October 18th required travel with a hotel stay. I am a very particular person with an attention-to-detail. I booked a stay at the Amalfi for 3 nights on business. At first impression, I was impressed by the reception staff dress in their sleek attire with very cool hats for the bell staff. It reminded me of something very fashionable and current. The front desk area was something that totally surprised me as it resembled a reception area of a bank officer with just desks and chairs. The lobby area was very small but just the same, very comfortable. Check-in was completed in less than 5 minutes max with a reservation. The â€œexperience designerâ€� (desk clerk) was somewhat unreceptive, but I too was very short due to my own issues with airport travel. Nonetheless, if you choose to work in customer service, exceeding the customer expectations is the difference between thriving in business today and closing-up shop tomorrow. I stayed on the 5th floor (hotel has six floors) with a horrible view but I suppose it is impossible for all rooms having great views since the hotel is situated in downtown Chicago with tall buildings all over. The room was very small but surprisingly very stylish & comfortable. The bed was average but I did not have issue with the sleep quality. The iPod docking alarm clock was a nice touch. The shower was fine with plenty of hot water and had a double shower head that I liked very much. The bathroom amenities in my opinion were very nice products. I rarely use products in hotels but I found these products of a very good quality. The desk area was comfortable, adequate to do my work, and great internet connection (complimentary). Overall lighting was an issue but I just removed a lamp shade to get lighter. The room has a very nice bar setup that is well stocked with over priced items but does have free tea and coffee. The TV is a 26-30 inch flat screen with the standard hotel channels and overpriced movies. I did like the added DVD player with free movies at the front desk for your convenience. My only really negative was the carpet in the room. It was filthy and embarrassing. A major carpet cleaning is definitely needed. The exercise room was below average but I improvised and good in a fair workout daily. Finally, I very much liked the idea of the continental breakfast on each floor where you did not need to get dressed to go eat and the complimentary cocktail hour (5:30-7Pm) every night with light snacks. All-in-all, I very much liked my stay at the Amalfi and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent busines hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: atrejseeratleve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Amalfi twice over the last few months and will definitely do so again. The Amalfi is in a great location just a few blocks from shopping and business districts, has comfy, clean and spacious rooms, and the service is always friendly and cheerful. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but serves a continental-style breakfast on each floor by the elevators -- a very nice spread with breads, yogurt, cheese, juices, cereals, coffee and tea. On weekdays, there's also a happy hour with drinks and snacks in the lounge. Around the corner are plenty of restaurant and nightlife options, and the hotel is within easy walking distance of the Golden Mile in one direction and Millennium Park area in the other. The hotel is great for business travelers as well as anyone visiting the city for pleasure...it's a 'no frills' hotel and just a really great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nearby nighclub ruins sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tampabay1954
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this hotel every year for 5 years but won't again. Seems that a nightclub moved in nearby and we could hear the bass thumping all night until 5:am. Upon complaining the reception person gave us a card and said "call me before you come NEXT TIME and we will get you a room away from the noise. I think hotel was full so that's why we were not offered another room. Stayed 4 nights and Sunday night was the only night we were not disturbed as the nightclub was closed. It's a shame as we always liked this hotel. Strange this is the first time we were NOT emailed a survey after out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: sdbarlow
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Amalfi...it is a smaller hotel and lobby, but very beautiful. The staff were VERY helpful and courteous, at the door, lobby, maids, etc. The breakfast every morning was great and plentiful and was kept filled. The complimentary drinks and appetizers in the evening were beautiful and good. The house drink amalfitini was GREAT!!! Our room was a good size for 4 of us and the bathroom was a very nice size, we never felt crowded. We will stay there again if we ever make it back to Chicago. Very good location as well to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: JayneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!! We stayed here for 6 nights and it was wonderful. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great, easily walk to shops, places to eat, etc. Breakfast was well catered for and nice to be able to take it back to your room to eat. The room was just spotless, so clean!!! The room itself was huge and the beds oh so comfy. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone, couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but something is weird with their shower”
Reviews.Author: cppexpert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friend for several nights. Overall it's good place in great location. Basically The Loop area is in walking distance from the hotel. The only thing I didn't like is inconsistent temperature of water stream. It jumps between hot and clod by itself. It's ok when you're washing your hands but it's kinda annoying when you're in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KG105
Reviews.Content: If you want a great hotel...near Michigan Avenue and the River...you can't beat the Amalfi! Daily continental breakfast on your floor - so no need to go downstairs. Daily manager's reception with amazing appetizers...and an open bar! And by far the friendliest staff I've ever had...anywhere! This is the spot if you are heading to Chicago for any reason and want to be downtown where all the action is!

Reviews.Title: “pet-friendly accomodation -- in style!”
Reviews.Author: violonchelista
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple days in Chicago before saying goodbye to extended family who were visiting us from Central America. We had our puppy with us, and we were worried that it would be difficult to find a hotel where we could stay with him, but the Amalfi Hotel turned out to be perfect! Not only did they out dog stay with us, but they also greeted him with a chew toy and playtime with the front desk staff! Room was elegant and unique. The free cocktail hour was nice, but be warned: they won't make you a martini; they only serve their signature Alamfi-tini. (I asked the bartender for a gin with olive, though, and he made that...) Overall a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Extraodinary”
Reviews.Author: Isaacsan
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel .. simple and cosy with it's unique hospitality and service for a standard price. Check in was prompt with a guy in a dragon outfit (memorable and impressive). The free cocktail every evening was outstanding, especially with the array of Italian and American beers and the heavenly AMALFINI cocktail. The salami and bruchetta.. superb. Why, even standing in the street for a taxi in fornt of the hotel was a pleasure... it had this courtesy heater by the curb to warm you up. Major attractions are just walking distance away.. the chanel, the shopping street, the theatre and best of all the famous Bar at the corner. Serves the best steak in town. Huge cuts and the mostest freshest. Do I sound like the marketing guy from this hotel.. ha ha Well I am not.. this is my 1st visit to Chicago and will definitely stay in this hotel if I travel to Chicago again. Cheerio. Isaac - Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: micko7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the end of our trip to the mid-west. Check-in was smooth and swift and the room was a great size. Cocktails and canapes in the evening were complimentary and just right before venturing out to dinner. we went across the road to Harry Carey's and there was a great atmosphere and good food. Michael at the lobby was really helpful with our bags and stored them while we completed our shopping, and gave us advice on getting to o'hare, and as with the previous reviewer, we took the blue line from Clark, just across the river, and it was great value and no traffic problems on route which took about 30 mins. All in all it was a good choice and i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCityDweller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched online for a good deal on a nice hotel in the city for the night after our wedding. The hotel markets itself well, and we were looking forward to the complimentary evening social, sit-down check-in service, in-room spa option(s), and good location. We were let down in every category except for location. The hotel is located in the heart of it all! A block from Howl at the Moon, 2 or so blocks from House of Blues. It's also on the other side of a FABULOUS Mexican joint, Dos Diablos (absolutely delish food), but other than that, everything was a let down. No pool, no bar, no restaurant (their "room service" food comes from Harry Carry's across the street), and nothing exceptional. The sit-down check-in was nice, but a little anti-climatic once you see the rest of the hotel. The rooms are large (for a downtown location), and I loved the Aveda bath products. But the evening social left much to be desired. The food was so-so, but the room that it's housed in is dark and awkwardly set up. We felt too out-of-place to even sit down and eat. Breakfast offered a nice spread, but for a Continental brekafast, I expected cold cereal - there was none. Coffee was mediocre, muffins and donuts tasted like gas station offerings. Overall, the room was clean and the staff was friendly. However, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Amalfi was great!”
Reviews.Author: Alison78
Reviews.Content: I hosted a family reunion at the Amalfi in August 2010, and was very impressed. The staff was very easy to work with in the planning stages. The group room rate was extremely competitive: by far the best rate I was quoted for any downtown hotel, including ones that are not as nice as the Amalfi. The rooms are very nice, with homey touches like CDs, books, etc. The beds were extremely comfortable, too---I slept like a baby! The staff was very helpful during our weekend stay, and very accomodating. The location is great, with lots of restaurants and bars very close by. The hotel's continental breakfast was good (included in the room rate), and the "happy hour" reception was impressive. I also liked that the hotel doesn't look "cookie-cutter"---the lobby and the rooms have some personality. In short, I was very impressed. I would recommend the Amalfi in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Amalfi!!”
Reviews.Author: DonLynski
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels over the years but the Amalfi has got to be our favorite... so far! The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is larger than most, and it is so very quiet., you can really get a good nights sleep there! Bed was comfy and the pillows were fluffy. We never heard anything except some street noise, maybe the odd siren, but nothing much more than that. What makes the Amalfi unique is that they not only offer you complimentary breakfast (available on each floor in front of the elevator) of fresh fruit, cereals, milk, an assortment of pastries, bagels and toast and the best coffee I have ever had at a hotel... but they also offer Happy Hour which also includes Italian style snacks, breads, cheese, Italian cold cuts, roasted peppers, artichoke hearts, and an assortment of other things (each day there were small changes) and of course free alcohol, beer, wine, martinis and other mixed drinks... and there are some hotel guests who sit there for the entire hour and half, enjoying if not taking advantage of the situation... The Amalfil is close to everything, and easily accessible by train from O'Hare airport, if your there for more than 3 days it is wise to get a 1 week pass from the Chicago Transit Authority, (23.00$) much cheaper than taking a cab and faster! You can ride the train and the bus on the same pass. Check out the Amalfi, you will appreciate the quiet and tranquil atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Inn the River North Area Near the Loop”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one evening during Labor Day Weekend. We got a last minute deal throught Hotwire or would not have know if the gem of a hotel. We typically like to stay in the River North area as there is a lot to see and do there. We arrived at 9:30 in the moring to drop off our bag. We are allowed to check in and were even invited to eat breakfast. The room was very comfortable and the staff was first-rate. The bed was so comfortable I had a hard time getting my wife out of it to do things. We also came back from sight seeing early to take advantage of the open bar happy hour which was great. The good they give you there is better than what you normally get from Embassy Suites or the Residence Inn. We did the valet parking for $44 and found it to be easy. There are many other options if you are looking to save money there. This is a very good hotel in the middle of all the action. They have a well trained staff that is happy and good at serving customors. I will look to stay here in the future as we always try to stay in the River North area.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegTraveller010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amalfi for 4 nights and chose the hotel based on its location, amenities, and good reviews. We were very happy with our stay and could not have asked for more. The location is very convenient and we were able to walk almost everywhere. Street noise was a little loud in the morning, but I think that's just the trade off to staying in a downtown, convenient location. The rooms were very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious - made it easy for two people to share the space. Double shower heads were very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable! We also really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning as well as the cocktail reception. We felt truly spoiled and would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great & seriously cool hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LiamBrussels_Belgium
Reviews.Content: This is a really fine & very cool hotel, with a special character all of its own. Great location in downtown Chicago. Fantastic value when we stayed there, admittedly having booked about 6 months in advance. Very friendly, helpful & efficient staff. Lovely design, good modern furniture, great beds. Some really nice & unusual touches : free buffet breakfast on each floor, free afternoon drinks & nibbles every day, selection of good DVD to borrow. Very comfortable rooms, good beds. All in all a seriously pleasant & cool hotel. We would strongly recommend it & will be sure to go back on future trips to chicago. Only one drawback, the air-conditioning (in August) was so powerful that we were cold in the room even when we turned it off, while it was swelteringly hot outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: Vidalson
Reviews.Content: For the price I payed (100 euros/night), I can tell that this is an amazing and very recomendable place. Modern but also confortable, it's ubication also is very good (near the Loop, 10 minuts walking from Millenium Park). Just one negative point: breakfast in the room is very good idea, but then there should be more chairs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful view, terrible pillows, and homeless people battle in the alley”
Reviews.Author: KMGIndy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Amalfi looking for a great boutique hotel in Chicago. The hotel is a nice property with clean rooms and nice amenities in a good location. However, when i booked the hotel I was offered an upgraded room from a king room to a corner king room for only $10 more. That was great until I checked in. The corner room looked at two brick walls and an alley. During the night there were several homeless individuals fighting in the alley. It would seem that this is a place for them to congregate. On top of this, the dumpsters in the alley were being emptied by the waste department between 5 and 6 am in the morning. The noise was crazy loud. I think this is a nice hotel with some unfortunate aspects due to its location. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: pkane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights. Chose the Amalfi based on the great reviews on here and the great value offered by Expedia. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Location was ideal as it was close to everything. Plenty of great restaurants nearby, about a 5 min walk from Michigan ave/Mag Mile or Navy Pier. A block away from the river. A short walk from Millennium Park. Some on here mentioned it's a sketchy/seedy area. Only noticed a couple weirdo's hanging out around the corner at night, but they're in the midst of everyone else. You're not in some back alley or anything. Nothing you don't see in any big city. The hotel has a nice boutique feel to it. Nothing really special about the room. Basic hotel room but no issues. The complimentary breakfasts every morning were great! They have a continental b-fast on EVERY floor. Plenty to choose from, as far as continentals go. The free Happy hour was a great addition as well! There's also some hors d'oeuvres. Free wifi internet was useful however this Highly recommend Hub 51 lounge/restaurant which is around the corner. Seems to be best on Thurs-Sat nights.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Lots”
Reviews.Author: Newman1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable but needs a little updating, the carpet was somewhat dirty (not bad but showing some wear). Bath was large and nice. Near lots of things but not exactly close to anything but resturuants. Overall a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met in Chicago for a conference and shared a room at the Amalfi. We stayed four busy days in town. I have no complaints at all. The hotel had a nice boutique feel, but certainly not the pinnacle of style. There was a standard continental breakfast, but the nice touch was that it was served by the elevators on each floor which was very convenient. There was also a cocktail hour. It was in a strange room that felt like a conference room, but one really can't complain about a complimentary drink and snack! We had a great rate with a prepaid expedia deal so we were very happy. That being said, if you are paying full price you might find a higher end hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it once was--sad”
Reviews.Author: prof
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times, with my spouse as well as with friends. Initially, the Amalfi was impressive, from the friendliness of the staff to the care and presentation of everything from the amenities in the room to the breakfast set up in the elevator lobby. But the last few visits suggested that this was slipping--and my most recent stay solidified this concern. The only staff that smiled or went out of their way to be polite were the housekeepers, the bartender and the doormen. The folks working the desks were "going through the motions"--seeming irritated when more people walked in, interested only in moving clients along--and the advice for food and activities was mediocre. The free internet wasn't working, and we were told by the staff "fixing" it that when the hotel is full, it cannot handle the amount of usage. And parking was $45 dollars a day--far more than competing hotels in the same area. It is a nice hotel and some of the amenities are good, but there are just SO many other boutique hotels nearby that aren't as expensive and give you better overall service.

Reviews.Title: “Good...but in need of some improvements”
Reviews.Author: RJACASILLAS
Reviews.Content: The stay was fine but not what their website suggest. The furniture in the room was in need of repairs, the room was clean but the pillows were smelly. Some of the carpets were dirty (elevators) and the complimentary breakfast was OK as long as you do not have any special dietary needs (no options avail at the hotel to upgrade the breakfast-no restaurant/cafeteria). Afternoon dine-in was not a whole lot better. Amalfi does not have an "in property"restaurant so they depend on a stakehouse across the street for their dine-in program. The food was not very good and prices were high. No other restaurants were close by (cab ride was required in order to have food alternatives). The hotel is well located for business trips and the staff was very helpful. I suppose this this is my issue with Amalfi...if you are paying "special rates" (under $150 per night) then this hotel is OK for the money but if you have their full published rares for your stay ($150 or over per night) then this hotel is probabbly not worth the asked rate and alternative accomodations should be explored.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, boutique hotel well located in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelfun6600
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet charming hotel walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Lovely room with well stocked bath. Breakfast conveniently located on our floor. Happy hour with great snacks. Extremely helpful staff. Will definitely be our number one choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JALDundee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi for 5 nights from 22 June.We chose it because Expedia had a really good deal and Trip Advisor gave it excellent reviews.The hotel has a modern lobby and very friendly,helpful reception staff.Our room was a good size and spotlessly clean.The continental breakfast served where the lifts are is excellent and a great idea.This is included in the price as is the evening cocktails and canapes which you must admit is great value! There are lots of good restaurants within walking distance and the shops on the Magnificent Mile are close by. A good tip is to buy a CTA travel card.The bus drivers we came across are really helpful if you're not quite sure and the L is a piece of cake to find your way around. Incidentally we looked at the hotel on Google Earth prior to travelling and West Kinzie Street doesn't look particularly salubrious however it is a lot better in the flesh! We will definitely stay at the Amalfi the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: tomato011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for our trip in July 2010. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this location. Location: Walking distance to most attractions: downtown, cloud gate, and the loop Room Service/Customer: great clean rooms, concierge answered any questions we had and offered suggestions for great restaurants and sites to see. What we enjoyed the most was the nice little touches that you don't get with the big chains such as the free wi-fi in the room, continental breakfast (which included fruits, pastry, yogurt and drinks) and complimentary happy hour from 530-7. I would definitely return to the Amalfi the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: happynuts
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Amalfi during the 4th of July long weekend and really enjoyed our stay. Here are the top things we liked: 1. Clean, big room 2. Short walk to many attractions (Mignificant Mile, Millenium Park, Navy Pier, The Loop, Architecture boat tour) 3. Cocktail hours 4. Breakfast in bed while watching World Cup (We grabbed breakfast from the hall and brought it back to the room) 5. Friendly and knowledgable staff 6. Short walk to nice restaurants (Harvey Carvey, Rockit, Dos Dablios, Webb Grill, R&D Grill, etc...) 7. The King size Bed & mattress. Here are the things we didn't like: 1. Room thermostats - we couldn't turn 'off' the fan, it was constantly blowing at us at night. 2. Room view. Our friends got the room on the 3rd Floor that faces the parking lot and Rockit Bar . The restaurant had a rock band playing one night with the windows wide open. So you can imagine the noise level that came out from the bar. Overall, the Pros far exceed the Cons. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys the experience boutique hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Checked into a room with dirty underwear, unclean toilet and empty beer bottles!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Archana2010
Reviews.Content: We were checked into a room with empty beer bottles, dirty underwear in the closet and unclean bathroom. There was no manager available for an hour to take any complaints. We missed our show because of the extra time it took in moving into another room etc. Finally when I got to talk to the manager and complained about beer bottles especially when I had a child and a teenager with me she offered to send me wine and cheese to make up for the inconvenience!!! Staff was somewhat reluctant to take request of extra blankets at night. They kept telling me to look into the closet for extra blankets. I asked for two blanket , but they delivered one. I had to keep calling to get settled. I saw a comment form from the prior guest in our room on the study desk, who had taken the trouble of filling it out, but no one collected it or cared for it. ht. Noisy rooms. Can hear the doors all night. Thebreakfast items kept running out and had to make calls to get them replenished. I will not recommend this hotel to any one even at discounted rates!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYBUG1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Amalfi. The staff were friendly and helpful ( made enquiries re baseball tickets , helped with directions and how to get around ) , the breakfast was great and so were the free drinks between 5.30pm and 7.00pm. The hotel and rooms were very nice. The bed was the biggest and most comforatable my wife and I have ever slept in. It was in a great location (across from The Trump Hotel ) and handy for the blue line that takes you to/from O'Hare. The only complaint we had was that the room was advertised as a "city view room" which was the reason my wife booked it as a surprise for my 40th birthday. The room was at the front on the 2nd floor and looked out onto a run down building. We asked to be moved however we were told that they only had rooms on the 4th floor on the other side of the hotel which also looked out onto a building. Don't know whether the view would be better from a higher level - however I think most hotels in Chicago probably have the same problem. Across the road was a blues bar and a Harry Caray bar. Only a short walk to Navy Pier. On the whole a great hotel and would not hesitate about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amalfi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: budbrlady
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Amalfi in Chicago. The location was very convenient for us. We took the South Shore train into town and the hotel was under 10 minutes walking time from the train. We also walked to Ed Debevic's for dinner, again a short walk. Harry Caray's is across the street and around the corner is also the House of Blues. We found the hotel to be very clean, everyone was very friendly. The night reception on the 6th floor is a great touch! Breakfast was nice to have in the hallway, I liked not having to be fully dressed and ready for my day before getting some juice. My Dd was thrilled they had glazed doughnuts for the kids. She used the hot water to make hot chocolate, a big deal for her. The bathroom is huge, it was refreshing to have that much room! The beds were very comfy and even though our room overlooked the alley it wasn't an issue. That happens in the city, not everything is a wonderful view. We loved our stay and hope to be back soon! My Dh now prefers this hotel to the Wyndham, that says alot for him!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: nanmontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi for several nights at the end of April and again at the end of May, both times for business with extra time to enjoy the wonderful city of Chicago. Both times my experience with the hotel was superb. Reception, and front desk in general, couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Among other things, on several occasions we received excellent recommendations for dining -- not so easy, because we required restaurants that were vegetarian friendly and not too noisy (since one of our party had hearing problems). However the task was made easier by the fact that the Amalfi is surrounded by many restaurants of all types. The favourite restaurants of those we tried were Mercadito (Mexican -- real Mexican, not Tex-Mex), Hub 51 (varied cuisine, heavy on Tex-Mex), and India House -- all in very easy walking distance from the hotel). The hotel itself is very attractive -- the lobby, the hotel rooms, the bathrooms. Only the lounge in which the hotel serves the free happy hour is somewhat dark and uninviting . . . though the drinks and appetizers are extraordinary considering that all is offered for free and with great friendliness by the staff in attendance. The breakfasts that are served in the well outfitted elevator lobbies on each floor, offer a wide variety -- coffee, tea, juices, milk, fresh fruit, yogurt, a variety of Danish, muffins, bagels, and sliced bread (with 2 toasters on each floor). And everything is frequently refreshed by staff who seem to continually move thru the floors to make sure everything is available. I have to say that I found it very pleasant in a hotel setting to make a quick trip down the hall in a bathrobe kindly provided by the hotel, to get my breakfast. The business centre offers four computers and a printer -- very convenient and very rarely fully occupied. We all enjoyed the Amalfi immensely and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again when back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: chuckster_dude
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Memorial Day weekend and we found it to be a very nice hotel with great value. It's located just 3 blocks from the State/Clark Loop station and is a short walk to Michigan Ave. For the price, the extras of the free breakfast on each floor, the nightly manager's reception with free cocktails and the later checkout time (standard for Noon but we got a 1 PM without extra cost), made it a great deal for the money. The regular room with king bed was a good size and clean, and the staff was cordial and friendly. We didn't mind having to eat breakfast in our room but I can see how that could turn some people off. Overall, it was all that was advertised and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: tp-mich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amalfi over Memorial Day weekend. I found a great deal on travelzoo.com and I'm glad we found this hotel. It is in a great location, about two blocks north of the river and about three blocks west of Michigan Avenue. The hotel features a small lobby, but the service at check-in was friendly and efficient. Our room was at the end of the hall and was large. I would say the features of the room were comparable with most other luxury hotels in Chicago. The room was very clean and comfortable and the king bed was great! My wife and I especially liked the free continental breakfast and the free evening reception on the 6th floor. The only drawback of our stay was that our room was right above an alley, which was constantly noisy. But, this was a minor setback compared to everything we loved about the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Amalfi to anyone staying in Chicago. TIP: Do not park at the hotel. Way too expensive. There is a parking garage about two blocks away on LaSalle and Kinzie that charges way less.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise; will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Neetz13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when my husband had a meeting in the hotel. I wasn't sure about what to expect since we usually stay in the Gold Coast. The hotel far exceeded all of my expectations - from the staff to the room accommodations to the amenities, it was a nearly perfect experience. It is truly a boutique hotel; you step into a small lobby featuring a waterfall and small tables for service (this actually is the only weakness we found because it meant a delay in check in). The rooms are surprisingly spacious, very quiet, and very well appointed with free wireless, very comfortable beds and linens. The hotel offers a lovely continental breakfast served on each floor, which we found both convenient and welcome, so we could relax and get ready in our room and enjoy it privately. The nicest feature was the lovely evening reception offered for guests, featuring antipasto and excellent drinks, including their signature Amalfitini - it was fabulous! The hotel staff were all exceptionally accommodating; they kept our bags after we checked out and even allowed me to use their business center afterwards, even though technically, I was no longer a guest. This was extraordinarily generous of them and helpful to me (I was under a deadline). While the hotel is not directly off of Michigan Avenue, it's only a short walk to the beginning of the Magnificent Mile and some of the city's best restaurants, or to museums in the Loop. During our short time there, I had no trouble doing major retail damage all the way up to Oak Street and down to Monroe Street! We will definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Theatre and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Crestwicke
Reviews.Content: Great hotel as it was close to Frontera Grill and to the theatre. Lots of good restaurants and bars close by. A bit away from Michigan Avenue, but nice. Happy hour and breakfast were nice touches. I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: bw548
Reviews.Content: I just took my daughter and a friend to Chicago to celebrate her 30th birthday. We were 3 women on our own in a new city. The Amalfi Hotel was a great place to stay! We felt safe and were in a great location. We could have been closer to Magnificent Mile but were glad to be centrally located for the subway access and to all attractions south of the river. We had no idea where the hotel was but it turned out to be perfect! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. We were right across the street from Harry Carey's restaurant and never heard a sound while we slept like babies all night. If you want a very easy, comfortable and safe place to stay then this is the place. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theresa418
Reviews.Content: We can not give this hotel a better review. From check in to check out! Friendly, accommodating staff. Continental breakfast bar, beautifully displayed. Evening cocktails and appetizers again wonderful.. The Hotel is perfectly located in heart of city, close to everything and including some great restaurants. We tell all our friends with family in Chicago this is where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephie674
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are great, very clean. This is a pet friendly hotel, we took our small dog with us. It would have been nice for the front desk to be able to tell us more than "go left is what I tell people" when inquiring about where our dog could potty. Response should have been, go left several blocks and across the street to a dog potty area near trump Towers. Also, check out is noon and maid was knocking on our door at 9:45 even with the DO NOT DISTURB sign on door. Good thing the security bar was set on the door, or she would have been in the room with us while we were sleeping. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tedferrer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay but, for me, a little bit far from the city proper where the activities are.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversary at the Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: pryanbaula
Reviews.Content: We arrived to an all time high temperature on Thursday 4/1 of 83 degrees just in time to enjoy some drinks at the reception hour. I was impressed with the type of liquor they used in the drinks and the selection. The continental breakfast did the trick, we didn't go out to breakfast once in the 3 mornings we were there. Some may complain that it doesn't have a big enough selection, but the evening reception more than made up for anything missing in the morning. My only complaint on the evening reception was the crying kid in the small room. Yes we have a child and a little sympathy, but when your child is crying and everyone has to listen to it gets annoying quick. Leave the evening reception to the adults, the parents can always get their drinks/ food and take it back to the room to share with the kids. Free wi fi was appreciated when looking for a place to eat, things to do, and which blues club to go to. The beds/ robes were comfy, the rooms were quiet. The building is only 6 floors high, so don't expect to get a fabulous view of the city. Rooms are on the small side, but the minor negatives don't come close to tainting my opinion of the experience at the Amalfi. This hotel was a great place for us to celebrate our anniversary, we had an epic weekend in Chicago. We've stayed in nicer rooms, but the whole package is tough to beat and if you're not happy, then you might just be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful, wonderful time at the Amalfi. It is so near to everything! We were happy to walk quite a bit, but it truly was close to things like the theater district, the Art Institute, and many of the must do pizza places. The "front desk" is SUPER trendy and modern, but they were always very helpful. There was also a free happy hour with really nice, light appetizers around 4? I believe. We got to the hotel after a trip from Boston just in time for this, so it was a wonderful surprise. We took the subway from the airport into the hotel area, and it was a LONG trip. However, we were happy that we did as the traffic outside our window seemed ridiculous and the trip would have likely been even longer. The room was well kept and clean, with a very contemporary feel to it. Seriously. It was a WONDERFUL base to explore the city as a first-timer to Chicago. Would love to stay there again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Family Getaway - First visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: aharrist
Reviews.Content: After researching several Chicago Hotels on the internet, we choose the Amalfi hotel in Chicago for several reasons. The hotel had great reviews on Tripadvisor, the hotel matched the lowest price I was able to find on the internet, the hotel looked beautiful on the web, it was in a great location and the hotel included daily complimentary continental breakfast and a manager's reception (a nice perk for a family, no need to worry about breakfast first thing in the morning, or dinner after a long day). It was great being able to step outside your room first thing in the morning in a hotel robe, grab some juice, coffee, bagel, etc and go back to your room and eat while getting ready for the day. Also, the food was constantly replenished. The hotel did not disappoint. The hotel was beautiful, in a great location (close to restaurants, shopping (miracle mile 2 blocks over), CVS, Walgreens), the staff was consistently friendly and helpful, everyone had a smile and greeted us, from the staff who put out the food in the morning, to the friendly bartender at the evening receptions. The rooms were a good size, and the beds were COMFY, (both my husband and our son commented on how comfortable the beds were). Overall the hotel made us feel very welcomed. When we go back to Chicago, we will definitely check out the AMALFI again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with wonderful perks but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: SusanEagan
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago for 3 nights. The best things about the hotel are: location, free continental breakfast, free manager's reception every evening with appetizers and drinks, comfortable beds, and quiet. A few minor setbacks include small rooms (4 of us in their biggest non-suite room was quite crowded), small lobby, and the view. The hotel worked great for our family, but it's not a very modern or elegant hotel. For example, we had great towels in the bathroom, but they weren't really folded. The doorman Raffie was always friendly and helpful but we would have appreciated more assistance from the front desk staff. I would recommend parking somewhere else. We paid $44 for the first night. The second day we found parking right next door (!) for $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff, perfect location, couldnt have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: kirby64
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. Rooms perfect, clean & modern - couldnt fault them, very quiet too. The staff were all very friendly, the breakfast was perfect, easy & complimentary. 100% recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is excellent to with some great restaurants & all the main shopping close by. We visited as a group & took seven rooms, everyone felt the same - we will be back. The manager was also excellent. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kfio
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on other reviews and were very happy with our decision. It is close enough to walk to Michigan Ave and most of the restaurants around there, but also only a block or two from the river, which is nice if you are wanting to walk to Millenium Park or the Loop area. The room was comfortable and spacious, the breakfast was very nice and the evening cocktail reception was outstanding. I'm still dreaming of their signature drink the 'Sorrento Sunset'. Mmmmm. We were there for the weekend and got the 1-day bus/train pass on the day we knew we wanted to go far around the city - it was such a deal...$5.50pp, I think. The hotel is in-between two train stops on the brown and red lines. You can only get the 1 day pass at certain places and the closet place to the hotel was the Jewel-Osco on State St. We would also recommend drinks or lunch on the John Hancock tower. As long as you are eating/drinking up there (Signature Room on the 95th or 96th floors) it is free to get up. I think it is about $15pp at both the Hancock building and Willis tower to get up to the observation decks, so at least with the Signature Room you are getting food or drink in return for the money you spend.

Reviews.Title: “UNIQUE, PERFECT LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes078
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Amalfi for the St. Patrick's Day weekend events and couldn't have been happier with the amenities, location, and staff. Our car was quickly valeted, room made available hours before check in, of course we could walk everywhere, and morning buffet station on our floor with great coffee and crossaints. I would come again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things Come In Small Packages!”
Reviews.Author: usafanScotland
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel has only six floors, making it easy to get to elevators and down to reception. The building is dwarfed amongst all the skyscrapers around it. Trump's huge new tower is just down the street. The Amalfi looks recently refurbished, very modern, but warm and inviting. Bedrooms quite spacious with lovely linens and very, very comfortable beds. Bathroom quite small but roomy enough, with Aveda tolietries and constant hot water in the showers. Continental style breakfast is set out fresh every morning in front of the elevator of every floor. Great to stumble out of bed and grab a coffee etc (robes & slippers provided) without having to get dressed for a formal breakfast. Really enjoyed the Managers evening cocktail reception, especially the Amalfitinis. A nice way to relax after a hard days' shopping! Location is great for all the shops, transport, museums etc. Easy walking to everywhere. Staff also very friendly and welcoming. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city (I'll be back)”
Reviews.Author: KEITHCOTTER
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I've been to the Amalfi a number of times. I had stayed at a few other hotels prior to our first stay at the Amalfi. However, once we stayed here, we've never thought about another hotel while in Chicago. The location is wonderful (and easy to get to). We typically just go up there for 2 - 3 days at a time. We just bring carry on luggage and hop the train from either O'Hare or Midway. It's only 3 blocks to the hotel once you're downtown. Once you are there, great restaurants, museums, Jazz or Blues clubs, etc. are all within walking distance. There are also free trolly's to get you around. On a couple of occasions I've purchased the 3 Day Metro Pass that allows you unlimited bus and train for a set fee. On some occasions we've been able to check in early (or to check out late). Even when that option is not available, they are always able to put your luggage in a secure area while you go enjoy the city. I've seen so many people mention the free breakfast on each floor. Everyone has their own opinion, but for me it is perfectly suited to get the day started. There is too much good food in Chicago to want to load up for breakfast. A piece of fruit, a muffin, and a cup of coffee and you're off to explore. On this latest visit I did notice that the nightly cocktail session has eliminated the top shelf booze that was previously provided. The hors d'oeuvres also were "toned down" a bit. I'm sure that is in line with the economic conditions throughout the US. Even so, stopping in each night for a cocktail or two and a little snack surely saves some decent $$$ prior to heading out each evening. There's not really much of a view from any room I've stayed in. On the other hand, the rooms are clean, nicely appointed, and comfortable. Just remember: Location, location, location. Of course all the nice things about the hotel would be of little value if it were staffed with an incompetent or unfreindly staff. For sure that is not the case. Check in and check out has always been smooth and (on the couple of occasions) when something is not quite right and you call down..... problem is fixed expeditiously and courteously. As stated above....... I'LL BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Escape”
Reviews.Author: Katsuko
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city. Located in busy downtown but it felt very private and secluded. My second visit to Chicago with my boy friend. I got a great deal and it included parking. Walked a few blocks to Shops at North Bridge, so great location. We only stayed for a night as we were on our way west. I had booked a corner king room but upon arriving was informed that there were no more corner rooms and got upgraded to a suite automatically. Kudos to all staff - very friendly, helpful and discreet. The amenities like the breakfast and cocktails in the evening are also very nice. I would definitely stay at this hotel again - great staff, great location, great rooms - what more is needed?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: GolfGuyLouisiana
Reviews.Content: This was out 4th trip to Chicago. My wife and I take annual shopping "Pilgrimages". The Amalfi is situated in an extraordinary locaion for walking, shopping, etc. The Chicago iver basically splits the pedestrian area in two; North and South River areas. The Amalfi is located one block north of the river and 3 blocks West. Donald Trump's new hotel tower is next door. A botique hotel, the Amalfi is not a part spot. No lobby bar, Starbucks or Ruth's Chris. However, all this is a 2 minute walk away. Baseball famed announcer Harry Cary's Restaurant is across the street. Great bar and steaks. Hotel rooom service actually comes from there. The happy hour is smal but quaint. It is in a converted room on the 6th floor. There are 2 types of beer and Amalfitinis; served in masse. Dont ask for an extra shot. The Amalfitinis are tasty but lacking in vodka. The light snacks are Italian (as is the bottle beer). The am breakfast is typically European; breads, jams, juices, etc. Hint...the hotel executive offices are located on the 4th floor; so...the breakfast on that floor is the last to be picked up. Each floor has its own breakfast at the elevator area. If you stay on the 3rd or lower floors, expect no view. We selected a corner room and paid $10 bucks extra per night. We has 30 linear feet of windows and a view of Trump Tower. The room was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was great. Flatscreen TV was nice. I pod docking station next to bed. Work desk with nice carpets and bedding. I will stay again. Wi F throughout. Noisy garbage pick up in the am

Reviews.Title: “You definitely want to stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: charliesmyangel
Reviews.Content: Great location. Beautifully appointed large rooms with premium bedding. Desk with free internet. Upscale continental breakfast with real pastries The happy hour with complimentary premium drinks and delicious hors d'oeuvres was a great way to wind down from a long day. One of the best hotels I have stayed at in Chicago. Definitely going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucyinthesky11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Thanksgiving, I think it's a quiet time so we got a very good rate of about $100.00. The location is great, within easy walking distance of all the major attractions of downtown Chicago. It's a small hotel taking up space in a larger building. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was tastefully decorated, very clean and comfortable. The view wasn't up to much, just a side alley with a glimpse of Chicago's famous skyline. The bathroom was spotless with a great range of upscale toiletries provided. We had a problem with the internet connection but my husband managed to get help with that and the problem was solved. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel but each morning a complimentary breakfast is available. The food is presented buffet style in the elevator lobby on each floor.
