On our own, we discovered nearby restaurant we enjoyed--Harry Carays (better than expected, and the chopped salad delicious), Frontera Grill, Brazzaz (new Brazilian place, where even a vegetarian could have a fabulous meal from their 'salad' bar), Smith & Wollensky (old-school steak house). The small annoyance of no local daily paper was more than offset by the free in-room wi-fi. We brought our laptop and read our news and planned our day online each day. All in all, the Amalfi is delightful. It reminded me of a W, but smaller, and with a warmer feel. You won't be disappointed with this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi great value”
Reviews.Author: dietalynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel July of 05. The check in was very smooth and quick. The room was large with lots of windows, however there was no view, we were on the 3rd floor, with a building right outside our window. The bed was very comfortable, pillow top mattress, feather pillows, and nice quality triple sheeting. The reception hour was wonderful. We had a great bartender and the appetizers were nice. The room was small, with not much seating, but other than that, all was more than acceptable. The location for us was perfect. We took advantage of the free trolley, which runs Memorial Day to Labor Day.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious Comfort, Style, and Chicago Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top-rate from every point of view. The front desk/concierge staff genuinely want to be helpful, and continually suggest activities, try to book tickets and restaurants, etc., etc. All the staff are welcoming and friendly: have to mention Kenneth, the wonderful barman in the 6th floor lounge. The hotel is on a quiet side street, walking distance to so many fabulous restaurants in the River North area, just far enough away from North Michigan (a 5-minute walk). Rooms are sleek and comfortable. Beds (the most important feature) are cozy; sheets are soft, as are bath towels. There is turndown service. In guest rooms, you can see that your hosts have tried to think of every little thing that would make your stay nicer, and their thoughtfulness makes a big difference. The best part are the breakfasts, which appear silently by 6:30 weekday mornings, and 7:00 on weekends, in the hall by the elevator--coffee and teas, rolls, muffins, danish, croissants, fruit, juices--all complimentary, to be taken back to your room for an unhurried start to the day. They offer robes and slippers, DVD's, cocktails--where else can you get an experience like this??? And for a reasonable price, if you can believe it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TrumperTraveler
Reviews.Content: The amalfi hotel in Chicago is awesome. I've stayed twice and both times I didn't want to leave. The pricing ranges from $99-$400/night, sometimes they have specials on their website. It's in the River West District, near everything you want to be near when in Chicago. Anyway, the staff is super, the rooms are totally comfortable, they have thought of all the small stuff like Aveda shampoo. You have to stay here it's great. Free cocktail hour at night and pastries in the morning. You won't want to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Greataunt
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Amalfi for a 3 day weekend. The staff is extremely helpful and gracious. The continental breakfast was first rate and we really enjoyed the happy hour. Our room was good sized and the bed was super comfortable. The location was very convenient for travel to the Loop, Lincoln Park and the Gold Coast. The lack of restaurant or large lobby was not a problem at all. Overall, this was a great stay and represented a terrific value!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Amalfi Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenwecan5960
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago and enjoyed everything about the Hotel. Most importantly our room was perfect with plenty of space, great jazz CD's in the room, wonderful bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. The staff was very helpful with every request. The Amalfi offers a great continential breakfast on every floor each morning with good coffee and a great selection of pastry's, fruit's and jucie's. We also enjoyed the managers receptions one evening where they offer a great choice of complementary cocktails and antipasta's for their guests. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Scrubs22
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Amalfi hotel. The location is great (Harry Careys, House of Blues within a block) The hotel staff were extremely helpful and very nice. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the shower (two heads) was very refreshing. Large rooms, nightly cocktail hour, complimentary breakfast, and a unheard of onlite rate, made my trip to Chicago one that I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi Hotel in Chicago is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days and 3 nights at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago and loved the way we were treated, loved the room and the breakfast is a lovely continental spread with fruit, pastries etc. laid out on each floor so it's very convenient. After all the traveling we do it was so nice to stay in a hotel that didn't have all the hustle and long lines of the larger chains. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating. We checked in a little early and there were no problems and since our return plane was leaving late they allowed us a later check out. The hotel is in a great location for walking just about everywhere with great restaurants within walking distance plus a couple of blocks to wonderful shopping. All in all we were very pleased to stay in this hotel and will definitely stay there when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi Hotel is Super Duper”
Reviews.Author: chestybushcrusher
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the nicest we have ever stayed in, which says a lot for how much we travel. They were accomodating, very kind, and the rooms were soooo comfy. We arrived on a very early flight into O'Hare and arrived at the hotel at 8AM on the day of our check-in. Normally this would have been a major problem, but they allowed us to check-in for no extra fee. This was great because we wanted to lay down after getting up so early. The rooms are very nicely decorated and clean. The bed was wonderful. Sheets must have been 400 thread count, felt like silk. The mattress was like a giant pillow and we slept like babies the whole stay. Other perks in the rooms were dvd player and dual headed shower. They also stock Aveda products in the bathroom, which is a breath of fresh air considering what most hotels use. We found the hotel to be very central to all the things we wanted to see and do while in Chicago. We never took a cab or train anywhere because walking was no problem. It was nice to be close to everything. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast that is served every morning on each floor only steps from your room. It is nice to go out there and grab some breakfast in your pajamas! They also have a complimentary cocktail party in their lounge for guests. We had some dirty martinis and they offered a spread of snacks such as Italian cold-cuts, breads, cheeses, olives, etc. Very Italian! This hotel did not leave anything out and I felt like it was great value for money. No wonder it rannks so high among Chicago's best hotels! Stay there! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lltAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for 3 nights in January 2005. It's a great hotel! Every person who works there will speak to you. The lady who laid out breakfast would chat to me every morning when I went to get coffee, pastries and juice in the robe and slippers provided. The rooms are very comfortable, great bathrooms and the hotel is very centrally located to all of downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marc291
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Amalfi for 8 nights, Great location in central downtown, the staff are friendly and canâ€™t do enough to help. The rooms are very well furnished to the highest standards, with loads of extras, like DVD players, CD's etc. Free DVD loan. Complimentary breakfast served on each floor, you just help yourself and return to your room. Free internet and free cocktails each evening in the lounge. Price was a lot less than the so called Top hotels with service and standards that beat them all. Have stayed in many hotels, the Amalfi rates as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Amalfi Hotel this past weekend, and we both loved it. I booked the reservation after reading all the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor, and I was not disappointed! The hotel is in a great location - easy walking distance from the State/Lake "L" station where we rode in from Midway, the Grand station from which we rode to Wrigley Field, and several restaurants (Morton's and Coco Pazzo were the two we tried). Our "Experience Designer," Juan, was absolutely terrific - when we arrived we told him that we'd love to see a Second City show and get tickets to the Bulls playoff game if at all possible, and by the time we got back from a walk in Millennium Park he had taken care of both for us! He was also very helpful with transportation recommendations and dinner suggestions. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was super friendly. Our room offered a nice view of the Marina Towers across the street, and the bed and bathroom exceeded my expectations. The Aveda bath products and dual shower head were a nice touch! The complimentary continental breakfast on every floor was a nice feature, and the food was better than most continental breakfasts I've had at other hotels. All in all, it was a wonderful experience, and we would definitely stay there again! I'd happily recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: perfection1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! Above and beyond any hotel I have stayed at in a long time and I travel alot. The staff was friendly and helpful - they remember your name. The rooms were spacious, modern and very comfortable. Bathroom shower was great. The cocktail reception everynight was an unexpected bonus. I still can't believe the great rate I got either. I booked directly with the hotel. The rate was a lot less than any other hotel in the city and the room was a lot nicer than most hotels. I was very impressed and will stay there over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: vincent1878
Reviews.Content: Stayed in enough places in downtown Chicago to know what I like and I liked the Amalfi. No doubt an unlimited budget obtains luxuries not available at this hotel. These have been covered in other reviews; views, room service, pool, spa, etc. and I suppose if they are important to you, they are available at a price elsewhere. But Amalfii is not utilitarian by any means. If you're looking for a generously-sized, nicely furnished room and gracious low-key service while you're doing other things in the city, the Amalfi is truly great. My wife and I found it was close to everything. We left the car parked, except for one excursion so we could have saved money w/o the valet service. We were advised at check-in that self-park was available ($22) but without in-out privileges. We did receive assurances about security for the extra $13/day but you need to allow about 15 minutes for retrieval. Many well known restaurants are nearby (within 5 minute walk) as is access to mass transit. We'll definitely make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Amalfi Hotel. Our room was wonderful, we almost didn't want to leave it! The location couldn't be better, blocks from the train station and from great shopping and Chicago Landmarks. They serve a very nice continental breakfast every morning on each floor so you can take it back to eat in the privacy of your room. They also have free coctails during happy hour in the lounge. A great experience and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: PapillonTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the International Kennel Club show in February. We we had our two little dogs with us, and the staff even made them feel special. They even gave us little bottles of doggie bubble bath for them when we checked in. We had three, long hard (but very successful!) days at the show, and the warmth of our room was very relaxing. We got back to our room too late to take advantage of the cocktail reception, but we will be staying again in July (just for fun!), so we hope to try it then. The warm colors of the rooms and deep, soft carpeting were very comforting after a long, hard day showing dogs at McCormick place. The rooms are very sound proof (within the hotel) which meant our dogs weren't hearing all kinds of noises. This helped them (and us) settle down and relax for the next day. Being in River North made it easy for us to find a place to eat dinner...even when we didn't get out until nearly 11 p.m. one night. Try Vong (VTK) one block north. It's very stylish, French/Thai. A nice place to relax. Mambo Grill, two blocks away, features Latin American cuisine. It also was very good and hip. If you are traveling avec chiens in summer, Brasserie Jo (country French/Alsatian cuisine) will let you dine with your dog at their sidewalk tables. They even serve complimentary steak tartar to the canine clientele. It's very popular treat for area dog lovers and you will likely see all shapes and sizes of dogs dining with gusto, some being delivered to the restaurant in limousines. I have only two minor complaints regarding the hotel. First, (and this is mostly my fault) I forgot to take the privacy sign off the door when we left. I asked one of the desk people to please tell housekeeping I had made this mistake. Unfortunately, the request wasn't communicated and we came back after a long, hard day to a dirty room. I mentioned this to the front desk and they soon sent someone up to empty our trash cans and freshen our towels. I guess the attention to detail and, as one reviewer mentioned, the concierge, are the only things that may be a hair overstated in the hotel promotions. The other small complaint is that on a late Fri. night, the streets around the hotel can still be very noisy...one downside of being in a hot nightlife location. I woke up a couple of times from car alarms, loud voices, etc. on the street. But I have to say I was restless and overly tired, so I may have been oversensitive at that point. The next night, I slept fine. Before I sign off, I have to mention the Aveda toiletries and thick, soft towels. They were a very appreciated respite after a tiring day. I really get the impression that this hotel is trying do do things a little bit nicer than the average chain hotel. There are a lot of reasons to try it, or to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Strong candidate for a solid night's sleep, but not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwpnewpaltz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very mixed bag, wildly over-rated by most reviewers, but still offering some real positives for the consideration of a traveler to Chicago. It's on the fringe of River North, just opposite Harry Caray's and a block and a half from the W River North (the former Nikko). Consequently, it's within walking distance of Oak Street's fancy shops to the North and the Buckingham Fountain and everything in between to the south. A stroll to the Shedd Aquarium on a nice day is well within reason. And there's a multi-line subway/L stop three blocks away at Clark/Lake. Positioning is thus great, although anyone who stays here should also understand it's down below Michigan Avenue, an area known for bars, adult book stores and so on, just like the hotels south of Geary (Hilton, Nikko) in San Francisco. It's not a big deal, but it's there. The rooms are of decent size and have the best beds and pillows you'll likely ever encounter. Fabrics are new and attractive. Sheets aren't bad at all. There's a real closet, deep enough to hang your clothes and your carry on bag, but not a week's worth of wardrobe. TV is enormous, clear, and has many interactive amenities. Air conditioning is highly responsive and quiet. It's a great night's sleep. The big negative about the room is the bathroom. Perhaps I'm one of the few people in America who cares about baths, but I don't think so. I didn't know they still made 9" deep bathtubs, but the Amalfi has managed to find a whole warehouse full. I find travel tiring and take a bath every night out of town, and I object to a bathtub so short and shallow that I can't cover both my knees and my private parts with water simultaneously. The bathroom is also dark, with little light, and the same might be said of the room as a whole, but it's more of a departure from the norm in the bathroom. I found the breakfast and the cocktail hour, both free, to be a plus. Didn't like the lobby, which is so basic that it makes the hotel seem even less fancy than the above review would suggest. Where I came out is that the price is good, and if travelling alone (which I was) and intent on some sightseeing, it's a fine choice, but I'd rather not bring my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an experience. I almost hate writing such a great review for fear that the secret will be out. This is the first time I have ever felt that I truly got what my money paid for. The only complaint I would have is that the managers reception on Saturday night was waaaayyyy to crowded for the room it was in. Everything you have read is true, amazing conceirge, incredible breakfast, helpful doorman, etc. I can't wait to go back so I can stay there again. If anyone ever says they had a subpar stay at the Amalfi is lying. The desk person ever had DVD's for us to sit in our room and watch (recent relaseses even) when we were tired. I cannot stop raving about this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amalfi last weekend and couldn't be happier with the stay. I read all of the excellent reviews about the Amalfi before staying there, and they didn't prepare me for the experience. The entire experience started when we walked in the door, where we were greeted by the friendly "Experience Designers" in the small but very stylish and well appointed lobby. The experience designers also made reservations for the nights dinner and gave us priority seating coupons for Gino's East which saved us an hours wait. The room was also spectacular, it was warm and inviting and extremely clean and luxurious. The room looked brand new, no stains or torn wallpaper found in other hotels. They had a collection of magazines, books, and CD's in the room for us to use, and we could check out DVDs in the lobby to play in the room's DVD player. The bathroom was equally clean and nice, with Aveda products a huge bonus. Location was good for restaurant hunting and shopping, it is located right next to the House of Blues and just over the river from State St shopping. It is also only a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. Best thing is that I paid $118 a night for one of the nicest hotels in Chicago. I couldn't be happier and cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlegypsyau
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It had a homely feel to it. Staff were most friendly and helpful. Rooms were well thought out , with lovely bathroom toiletries. There is a cd player with a range of cds to chose from. Breakfast with pastries and juice is an added bonus. I was very impressed by this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best New Hotel Experience in Years”
Reviews.Author: Bucky52
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently for business and pleasure and the Amalfi is the best new hotel exprience we've had in years. The rooms are stylish and comfortable, featuring especially high quality sheets and towels. They also provide both ethernet and wireless internet access. The complementary breakfast buffet on each floor is notable for especially good fresh fruit, pastry and coffee. The complementary cock-tail hour reception includes excellent ante pasta and premium liquors. The staff is uniformly pleasant and helpful. Finally, the location could hardly be better for access to theather, music, museums and shopping. We'll be back. Rebecca and David, Haslett, MI

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, price, and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Amalfi last week for 2 nights after reading the reviews on this website. I poured over the reviews of all the hotels and finally decided on this one. I couldn't have been happier with the choice. The rooms are large for a downtown hotel and are well decorated. The bed was more comfortable than my own. It was similar to Westin's "Heavenly Beds". They had the dual showerheads in the bath with Aveda products. They also had nightly turndown service. I loved the breakfast provided on each floor. You could take what you wanted back to your room instead of hanging out in a restaurant in the mornings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The proximity to Michigan Avenue for the all the shopping and museum sightseeing was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Ourselves Immensely”
Reviews.Author: Cyberhog
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Amalfi. It is within walking distance of almost every major attraction in downtown Chicago (one mile or less). We really enjoyed the upscale touches with the bed linnens, the dual Speakman shower heads, the small selection of CDs and magazines along with a free continental breakfast on each floor and daily cocktail party with appetizers. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The rooms are sleek and contemporary much like the lobby, although they are not overly large or posh. We found the Amalfi for under 130 dollars a night at Orbitz and agreed that it was a real bargain for what we got in terms of service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend trip to visit relatives and stayed at the Amalfi. I intend to return again and again. Chicago is C O L D in the winter: it was 4 degrees outside but warm and toasty inside. I was in the lobby at one point, needing to go about a block away. I didn't have my coat with me, the desk staff offered me their coats. Another time I needed a Diet Coke (I am not a coffee drinker) and instead of pointing me to a $2.00 vending machine, they produced two on the spot. I dug in my pocket to pay and said, it's on us. The rooms are not big and not small. They are right and contain a large bed with an incredible mattress. Bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. The free breakfast is high quality, convenient and generous. The cocktail reception features nice snacks and quality swill. I particularly liked the Peroni. Best of all is the location. It is smack in the middle of the best part of Chicago. Great restaurants. Great shopping. Much to see and do. Go there. Be there.

Reviews.Title: “birthday”
Reviews.Author: dawn0426
Reviews.Content: my sister and i stayed there for my birthday in april of 2004. the only thing i can say they had a problem with was the coffee maker. it was in a really stupid place. under the tv in the entertainment center. you couldn't pour water in it without making a mess. and try and figure out how to unplug it was a mind bender. and the refridge didn't work, which we both had come back with nice size pieces of prime rib from a steakhouse and put in the fridge, not realizing it didn't work until we were packing up to leave in the morning. which by then who is going to eat it after it sat in a really warm fridge over night. that kind of irritated me, but other than that, i would stay there again. the little bar next store was a riot. we had alot of fun there. i will definitely be back there sometime soon.
